Description

-AMENDED-
Amended to revise salary.

Should additional positions become available with five (5) months of the closing date, the applicant pool from this posting may be used to fill additional positions.

When you come to work for New Jersey Judiciary you will join an 8500-member strong TEAM that operates with the highest standards of independence, integrity, fairness and quality service. You will be engaged with work that has purpose, meaning and makes a difference in lives of the public we serve. We work hard every day to build the public’s trust and confidence in our court system, which includes issues such as bail reform, marijuana decriminalization and recovery court. Whether it be in a courtroom, an administrative office, a courthouse training room, an IT office or in the field, our Judiciary workforce is improving the lives of countless individuals and families every day. We honor the dignity and individualism of each member of our organization while fostering professionalism and continuous improvement in our work.

SALARY: The salary range for this position is $64,964.77 to $110,127.55 for Schedule A, and $64,964.77 to $104,621.19 for Schedule B. For newly hired individuals, the starting salary will normally be at the minimum of the salary range. For current Judiciary employees, salary upon promotion or advancement will be an increase of 5% of base salary, not to exceed the maximum of the range, or the minimum salary of the band/level, whichever is greater. Judiciary employees hired prior to June 3, 2014, are considered Schedule A. Newly hired individuals, and Judiciary employees hired on or after June 3, 2014, are considered Schedule B.

The Judiciary offers a strong opportunity for growth.


The New Jersey Judiciary is seeking an experienced business analyst to work under the general direction of the chief or other supervisory personnel in the Automated Trial Court Services Unit (ATCSU). This unit is primarily responsible for business analysis and user requirements gathering; workflow analysis; development of project plans; user interface; system testing; and user training and support. The unit works collaboratively with court case processing managers and staff, information technology managers and staff, and others to plan and implement large scale Judiciary information technology projects. It also provides ongoing customer support and delivers presentations, when necessary, to various customers located throughout the state. Experience with all stages of the SDLC, PEGA and Agile methodology is preferred.

REMOTE WORK: The Judiciary currently offers a hybrid work schedule, and this position may qualify for up to 3 days of remote work outside of Judiciary buildings. To participate in this program, you will be required to have high speed home internet access.

Example of Duties

Writing specifications for new applications and enhancements
Recommending process and design changes to case management systems
Analyzing business procedures, workflows, policies, and standards to identify appropriate IT solutions for the business community
Creating and managing project requirements with related project milestones and schedules; formulating reports to track/monitor project progress
Defining and documenting customer business functions and processes
Acting as a liaison between stakeholders and software development teams
Communicating and collaborating with external and internal customers to analyze information needs and functional requirements in delivering business requirements documents (e.g., UI designs, screen-flow diagrams; wireframes & user interface specification documentation)
Developing test scripts and performing a variety of system and user testing across multiple platforms
Coordinating regularly with ITO and business users
Designing and conducting presentations and training sessions to internal and external customers (including judges, court staff, attorneys, and other governmental entities)
Conducting interviews to research and analyze work methods, processes, and programs
Planning, organizing, and facilitating meetings or site visits with primary stakeholders
Providing helpdesk and on-site user support
Performing other related duties as required
The selected candidate(s) may be required to work a non-traditional work week, which may include weekends and holidays.

Qualifications

Graduation from an accredited college or university with a Bachelor's Degree in a field related to computer science, information technology or the area to which the applicant is applying, such as information systems, human-computer interaction, interactive media, software engineering, computer networking, and/or cybersecurity and one (1) year of professional experience in: analyzing, designing, programming, troubleshooting, resolving technical problems, testing, defining business requirements, training and/or installing computer systems applications OR planning, acquiring, installing and implementing telecommunications facilities and services, wide area networks, or local area networks OR generating and maintaining system software.

Substitution: Applicants who do not possess the required education may substitute additional paraprofessional and/or professional IT technical experience or experience related to the area to which the applicant is applying on a year for year basis with one year of such experience being equal to 30 semester hour credits.

A Bachelor's Degree in any field from an accredited college or university and one year of additional paraprofessional and/or professional IT technical experience or experience related to the area to which the applicant is applying may be substituted for the required education.

An Associate's Degree in a field related to computer science, information technology or the area to which the applicant is applying, such as information systems, human-computer interaction, interactive media, software engineering, computer networking, and/or cybersecurity and two (2) years of additional paraprofessional and/or professional IT technical experience or experience related to the area to which the applicant is applying may be substituted for a the required education.

An Associate's Degree in any field from an accredited college or university and three years of additional paraprofessional and/or professional IT technical experience or experience related to the area to which the applicant is applying may be substituted for the required education.

A Master's Degree in a field related to computer science, information technology or the area to which the applicant is applying, such as information systems, human-computer interaction, interactive media, software engineering, computer networking, and/or cybersecurity may be substituted for the required education.

Education Note: Degrees conferred outside of the United States must be evaluated by a recognized evaluation service.(See www.naces.org/members.html)

Supplemental Information

Physical Ability: For some positions, applicants must have the ability to perform work which requires climbing and prolonged standing, stretching, bending and reaching. The selected candidate must be able to frequently lift and carry supplies weighing from 30 to 50 pounds and, occasionally, materials weighing up to 75 pounds.

Driver's License: Appointee will be required to possess a driver's license valid in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle is necessary to perform essential duties of the position.

Authorization to Work: US citizenship is not required. Selected candidate must be authorized to work in the US according to Department of Homeland Security, US Citizenship and Immigration Services regulations.

Special Note: Newly hired employees must agree to a thorough background check that will include fingerprinting. All data received will be kept in strict confidence except to inform the individual of the findings and what action will be taken as a result of this information.

Residency Law: In accordance with N.J.S.A. 52:14-7 (L. 2011, Chapter 70), the "New Jersey First Act," all persons newly hired by the Judiciary within one year must establish, and then maintain, principal residence in the State of New Jersey. Any person may request an exemption from that requirement from the Employee Residency Review Committee in the Department of Labor & Workforce Development on the basis of either hardship or employer critical need.

HOW TO APPLY:

The NJ Judiciary requires all applicants to complete the application process fully and as instructed. All applicants must complete the work experience and education sections and attach any required documents. Applications must describe all relevant work experience in detail, beginning with your current or most recent job, including military service (indicate rank), internships and job-related volunteer work, if applicable. Use a separate section to describe each position. Applicants who indicate "see resume" or enter their initials to acknowledge that they have skipped the Work History and Education sections will not be considered, unless they do not possess any education history or work experience. Only applicants that follow the application instructions and submit completed applications will be considered.

The New Jersey Judiciary consists of: the Supreme Court, the Superior Court including the Appellate Division and the Trial Court of the 15 vicinages in New Jersey, the Tax Court and the Municipal Court System. The Administrative Office of the Courts provides technical assistance, operational support, training, research and development, budget and personnel coordination, and development and operation of information systems for the Courts of New Jersey.


The Judiciary of New Jersey is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action
Employer Committed to Ensuring an Open Door to Justice

Company Name: William Paterson University of New Jersey
Job Description:
William Paterson University invites applications for the full-time position of Data Analyst within the Department of Institutional Effectiveness.




Reporting to the AVP of Institutional Effectiveness (IE) and working closely with the Associate Director, the Data Analyst serves as a key member of the IE team that works to support and promote data-informed decisions. The Data Analyst works independently and collaboratively on external reporting mandates and internal analytical projects.




Note: This position can be fully onsite, hybrid, or fully remote, based on institutional need and an agreement with the successful candidate.

Duties and Responsibilities:


Duties and responsibilities include, but are not limited to

Fulfills mandated state and national data reporting requirements, including IPEDS.
Responds to internal data requests from campus stakeholders.
Supports administration of internal and external surveys.
Develops and maintains in-depth knowledge of the data and information needs of the University community.
Works collaboratively with data stewards to understand functional business processes and standards, and to identify areas for improvement.
Advances IE’s efforts in data visualization and the provision of actionable information to the University community.
Works with various constituents on Data Governance and other University initiatives, as needed.
Performs other duties as assigned that are appropriate for the position.



Qualifications:


Required qualifications

Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university.
At least four years of experience in a data-related field.
Advanced knowledge of and experience with SAS, SQL or similar data extraction and reporting tools.
Knowledge of data visualization techniques.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite applications, including Excel.



Preferred qualifications

Master’s degree.
Experience with mandated state and federal reporting, including IPEDS.
Experience with tools such as Power BI or Tableau.
Experience with data governance a plus.
Experience with Banner, Workday, or similar enterprise data systems a plus.



Attributes and traits

Demonstrated ability to prioritize work and changing priorities in order to meet agreed-upon deadlines.
Ability to communicate effectively in both written and oral format.
Capable of effectively collaborating with a diverse range of constituents.
Demonstrated ability to work independently.



Invitation to apply

Interested candidates will be prompted to: Complete an application and submit a cover letter

Submission of all documents listed is required for consideration.

General questions related to this application process, please contact talent@wpunj.edu

Cover Letter, Resume/CV

Job Title: Tableau Experienced Business Analyst / Data Analyst
Job Description:
The New Jersey Turnpike Authority is need of a Tableau experienced data or business analyst. The ideal candidate should have at least 5 years recent working experience with Tableau.

Under the general direction of the Assistant Director of Data and Performance Services, the Business Intelligence & Business Analytics Administrator develops, maintains, manages, administers, and supports the Authority’s data warehouse. The position focuses on identifying opportunities to create data marts and data warehouses, which will provide upper management with reliable information in order to make informed decisions on day-to-day business objectives, as well as, long term projects. This position also includes a wide range of responsibilities and duties regarding business intelligence and business analytics tools, and platforms, which are in accordance with the Authority’s goals and requirements.

1. Work with other departments to prioritize business and information needs, as well as, identify opportunities for improvement.

2. Collaborate with team members to collect, standardize, and analyze data.

3. Acquire data from various data sources; primary, secondary, or tertiary, and maintain databases and data systems.

4. Structure large data sets to find usable information.

5. Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics, and other strategies which optimize statistical efficiency and quality.

6. Filter, “clean,” and troubleshoot data to correct problems.

7. Interpret data and analyze results using statistical techniques and apply business intelligence and business analytics tools to visualize the data.

8. Design dashboards and reports from different data sources.

9. Establish and maintain best practices, which include defining governance processes, policies, guidelines, roles, and responsibilities.

10. Review policies and procedures, as well as, roles and responsibilities to adapt to, evolve into, and remain compliant with business and/or regulatory requirements.

11. Serve as the in-house expert on data visualization.

12. Enable users to customize reports without requiring programing support.

13. Ensure projects hit milestones on time and escalate to proper stakeholders as needed.

14. Solid understanding of project management methodology, including the ability to troubleshoot project roadblocks and proactively seeks solutions to meet deadlines.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

1. Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Management, or Statistics.

2. Five (5) years of experience with Tableau.

3. One (1) to three (3) years of experience with data visualization tools.

4. Working experience as a data analyst and/or business data analyst a must.

5. Practical work experience in developing and maintaining dashboards and visualizations in Tableau.

6. Ability to write queries, reports, and configure dashboards in Tableau.

7. Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining, and segmentation techniques.

8. Strong knowledge and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects), databases (SQL and Oracle), and programming languages (XML, JavaScript, and ETL frameworks).

9. Knowledge using statistical packages for analyzing datasets such as Excel, SPSS, and SAS.

10. Strong analytical skills and ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.

11. Strong interpersonal, communication, and group collaboration skills.

12. Ability to work with diverse teams.

13. Ability to perform under pressure and manage multiple priorities, independently and as part of a team.

Hydrogeologist / Environmental Data Analyst

McLane Environmental is currently seeking a mid-level (MS degree level or above) hydro / geo / environmental scientist who is accomplished in analyzing geologic data, aquifer data, and groundwater contaminant data. Solid academic training or experience in hydrology and groundwater flow is required, as is some experience with groundwater flow system modeling or analysis methods. Previous groundwater project consulting experience is preferred but not required. Task or project management experience would be considered a plus, as would experience with hydrogeologic and environmental data analysis programs (e.g. contouring, aquifer test analysis, GIS, data plotting, flow and transport modeling, etc.). Responsibilities for the Hydrogeologist / Environmental Data Analyst position include, but are not limited to:

Evaluation and interpretation of environmental data
Working as a member of a project team to develop a solid site conceptual model and to outline the project tasks need to meet project requirements
Application of data analysis techniques to support permit applications or evaluate groundwater remedy alternatives.
Processing and analysis of model data and related geospatial data
Analysis of aquifer test data or similar aquifer system measurements to evaluate potential groundwater supplies and wellfields
Applying or overseeing project groundwater flow and contaminant transport models
Evaluation of contaminant plume movement for potential receptor risk assessments or monitored natural attenuation remedy applications
Review and synthesis of hydrogeologic studies, environmental reports, and other technical documents and information
Preparation of technical reports, graphics and client presentations
Oversight and management of project tasks and analyses by working with and directing junior staff members
Assistance with business development activities, including assistance with the development of project proposals and cost estimates, and attending conferences and other networking events to make new connections

McLane Environmental, LLC is a premier provider of quantitative groundwater services, including groundwater modeling, GIS mapping and data management, 3D data visualization and analysis, environmental forensics, and litigation support. We specialize in providing environmental consulting services to corporate clients, municipal and government agencies, and law firms nationwide. Our team excels in providing high-quality hydrogeologic consulting and strategic environmental services in the areas of resource management, water supply, wastewater engineering, mining hydrology, contaminant fate and transport, and site characterization and remediation. While computer modeling and data analysis are a core competency of our firm, your role would extend well beyond that. You would be an integral part of a broad-based strategic-thinking, clear-communicating team where multiple facets of hydrogeologic science are applied in reaching the right solution to a problem.

We offer a competitive salary and full benefits package. The Princeton area is great for work, family, and recreation, and is close to Philadelphia, New York City, and many outdoor recreation areas. For more information on our company and the Princeton area, visit our website at www.McLaneEnv.com. U.S. Citizen, LPR I-155 cardholder, TN visa-eligible only.

Job Title: IT Business Analyst - Data (Remote or Morristown, NJ)
Job Description:
Crum & Forster Company Overview:

Crum & Forster (C&F), with a proud history dating to 1822, provides specialty and standard commercial lines insurance products through our admitted and surplus lines insurance companies. C&F enjoys a financial strength rating of "A" (Excellent) by AM Best and is proud of our superior customer service platform. Our claims and risk engineering services are recognized as among the best in the industry.

Our most valuable asset is our people: more than 2000 employees in locations throughout the United States. The company is increasingly winning recognition as a great place to work, earning several workplace and wellness awards, including the October 2023 Great Place to Work® Award for our employee-first focus and our steadfast commitment to diversity, equity and Inclusion.

C&F is part of Fairfax Financial Holdings, a global, billion dollar organization. For more information about Crum & Forster, please visit our website: www.cfins.com.



Job Description:

IT Business Analyst - Data (Remote)


Business Overivew:


Crum & Forster provides specialty and standard commercial lines insurance products through our admitted and surplus lines insurance companies. Operating out of our corporate offices in Morristown, New Jersey, and ten regional offices, we distribute our products through approximately 1,500 authorized retail and wholesale brokers across the United States. We are looking for innovative, talented, and self-motivated individuals who are interested in working with a cross-functional team focused on implementing and supporting a CAESAR Data Warehouse (i.e. Enterprise Data Warehouse).

The C&F IT Organization leverages Agile principles to achieve success in its support of the business. IT resources are assigned to squads that have specific missions. Each squad consists of a cross-functional set of team members from the various disciplines that are needed to complete the mission. Business Analyst for Data Warehouse team in P&C insurance.




What you will do:

Describe the business need in the form of User Stories and Acceptance Criteria Organizes and documents supporting detailed requirements
Ensures that the other squad members have a clear understanding of the business needs and requirements Works closely with other team members to ensure quality deliverables that are fit for purpose
Provides a thorough analysis of issues & solutions
The position will also include analysis for Bureau Reporting (Unit Stat, ISO and Mass Auto, NCCI, SFAA)
The Business Analyst works very closely with all stakeholders including business customers, vendors, and internal resources in order to facilitate team communication and achieve the squad’s mission
Work with our Stakeholders and understand their business requirements
Work with the CAESAR team to come up with a solution to accommodate Business & Technical Requirements Liaison between business and technology
Analyze processes and data to identify any opportunities related to process optimization
Make a transformation or migration easier for our Business Translate complex business processes during development Create and finalize requirements for any new Reports Work with business and IT to integrate new data sets Identify opportunities to improve existing data sets Analyze data to improve Data Quality
Help users understand our data eco-system Bring more data awareness within business and IT
Work with the business and IT to mitigate current and future data issues or challenges
Ability to analyze and decompose problem statements, distilling these into clearly defined requirements.
A confident and effective communicator, with experience and comfort addressing and collaborating with IT and business stakeholders and other sr/jr team members
Ability to impart complex information in an easily digestible form, to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Act as a bridge between the Business and Technology using technical and analytical skills to enhance or implement new Data Warehouse processes
Identify ways to improve existing data quality
Validate data, as needed, and test applications for business requirements, functionality, and usability
Gathers, analyzes, defines, and documents requirements and communicates them to the technical & non-technical audience
-Define and deliver metrics, reports, dashboards, and data warehousing solutions for tracking and managing the business objectives -Identify ways to incorporate automation in any deliverables
Identify business challenges and initiate process improvement projects Facilitate and help modernize the data ingestion and consumption process Create Business flow/Data Flow diagrams
Create a Source to target mappings
Provide analyses for large datasets necessary for decisions using actionable insights Collaborate with various business groups to build scalable processes and metrics
Responsible for carrying out complex analysis of datasets and conducting appropriate data validation Responsible for gathering and validating datasets across multiple data sources
Responsible for identifying and implementing key insights
Provide information on analytic results to business and functional leaders using visualizations to communicate data and metrics, including data maps, leveraging Tableau, etc.
Define KPIs to track key business processes

What you will bring to C&F:

A bachelor’s degree and 3+ years of experience in Business Analysis of Data Warehouse, data, and its processes
Experience with writing complex SQL is a must
Excellent analytical, mathematical, and creative problem-solving skills Excellent listening, interpersonal, written, and oral communication skills Logical and efficient, with keen attention to detail
Highly self-motivated and directed
Understanding and working experience with cloud technologies is a plus (i.e. Azure, Snowflake) Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks
Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment Familiar with Jira, Confluence, and Agile Processes

#LI-MS

#LI-REMOTE
What C&F will bring to you:
Competitive compensation package
Generous 401K employer match
Employee Stock Purchase plan with employer matching
Generous Paid Time Off
Excellent benefits that go beyond health, dental & vision. Our programs are focused on your whole family’s wellness, including your physical, mental and financial wellbeing
A core C&F tenet is owning your career development, so we provide a wealth of ways for you to keep learning, including tuition reimbursement, industry-related certifications and professional training to keep you progressing on your chosen path

Good storytelling starts with great listening. At Audible, that means each role and every project has our audience in mind. Because the same people who design, develop, and deploy our products also happen to use them. To us, that speaks volumes.

ABOUT THIS ROLE
In this key role, you will be at the forefront of shaping and advancing our Data Engineering solutions, primarily through the enhancement of our existing data platform. Additionally, you will collaborate with various elements of our global data ecosystem. Working closely with Global Analytics business stakeholders, your duties will encompass data integration, data modeling, execution of ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes, and the implementation of flexible data solutions. These solutions will be meticulously designed with a strong emphasis on data quality, adhering to the best practices in data warehousing. These efforts are crucial for the success of our data-driven initiatives.

ABOUT YOU
You are a highly skilled programming specialist who will be actively involved in the design, development, troubleshooting, debugging, evaluation, support, and enhancement of data engineering solutions. You will leverage existing system architectures to expand the capabilities of these applications, with a strong focus on optimizing data pipelines. This will result in more efficient and streamlined data processes, ultimately empowering end users to excel in their tasks with increased effectiveness and efficiency.

As a Senior Programmer Analyst, you will...

Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to assess source systems, identify foundational data sources, determine transformation needs, create appropriate data models, and document the design and specifications
Develop systems and datasets by applying software engineering best practices, fundamental data management principles, contemporary distributed systems
Create, maintain, and optimize data pipelines for ingesting, transforming, and loading data from various sources into data storage systems
Identify and resolve performance bottlenecks in data pipelines, databases, and related systems
Demonstrate passion for quality and productivity by use of efficient development techniques, standards and guidelines
Produce technical documentation to support data delivery development

ABOUT AUDIBLE
At Audible, we innovate and inspire through the power of voice. We're changing the narrative on storytelling. As a leading creator and provider of premium audio storytelling, we've redefined the ways people access, discover, and share stories. The stories we tell have the ability to transport and transform everyday moments into meaningful experiences and it's our people who make Audible's service possible. We're listeners, storytellers, and problem-solvers. Our perspectives and experiences power our ideas and come together in our mission to unleash the power of the spoken word. Audible offers a Hub+Home hybrid workplace model that gives employees flexibility between gathering in an Audible workspace (work from hub) and remote work (work from home). For more information, please visit adbl.co/hybrid.

We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:

Newark, NJ, USA
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s degree or higher in computer science or equivalent
3+ years of experience in a Data Warehouse (DWH) environment and experience with Data integration/ETL of large and complex data sets
Expertise in performance tuning and scaling of BI systems
Proficiency in SQL and database technologies such as AWS Redshift and expertise in performance tuning and scaling in a DWH environment
Data modeling skills such as Star/Snowflake schema design for DWH
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Good interpersonal and communication skills
Ability to work with different teams for sourcing of data
Knowledge of scripting for automation (e.g. Python)
Effective analytical, troubleshooting and problem-solving skills
Ability to learn fast, work independently with little supervision and deliver on time quality products
Experience with Agile Scrum

Job Title: Senior IT Business Analyst, Research IT
Job Description:
Working with Us
Challenging. Meaningful. Life-changing. Those aren’t words that are usually associated with a job. But working at Bristol Myers Squibb is anything but usual. Here, uniquely interesting work happens every day, in every department. From optimizing a production line to the latest breakthroughs in cell therapy, this is work that transforms the lives of patients, and the careers of those who do it. You’ll get the chance to grow and thrive through opportunities uncommon in scale and scope, alongside high-achieving teams rich in diversity. Take your career farther than you thought possible.

Bristol Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees with the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives. Read more: careers.bms.com/working-with-us.

Position Summary:

BMS is seeking a passionate, inquisitive, and energetic leader to enable change in a world-class pharmaceutical enterprise by defining needs and recommending solutions that deliver value to our Drug Discovery Researchers.

The Senior IT Business Analyst (Sr. IT BA) is accountable for the effective delivery of IT capabilities and services supporting BMS Research, with broad focus on the Small Molecule Drug Discovery (SMDD), Pharmaceutical Candidate Optimization (PCO), Nonclinical Safety & Veterinary Sciences (NCS/VS), and Mechanisms of Cancer Resistance (MoCR) organizations.

This individual will partner with IT colleagues and scientific researchers to identify, define, and drive digital capabilities to meet specific strategic and operational needs, including cross functional initiatives enabling the broader Research and IT organizations.

The Sr. IT BA will be a member of a cross-functional Technology team who flexibly analyze digital capabilities aligned directly to business functions. This individual will collaborate with IT Business Partners, Product Managers, Digital Capability Managers, Domain-focused Scientific Researchers, and other Enabling partners with cross-functional insights. Furthermore, the Sr. IT BA will be expected to oversee Jr. IT Business Analysts and Consultants on the delivery of technical capabilities.

The Sr. IT BA’s contributions will shape BMS’s abilities to discover, develop, and deliver innovative medicines that help patients prevail over serious diseases. Success in this role will leverage analysis and problem-solving skills that create positive, value-producing solutions.

Key Responsibilities:

Partners with IT Peers: Research IT to provide insightful and actionable analysis in support of the portfolio of digital capability investments.

Shapes Business Demands: Elicits business needs with creative empathy, maps complex processes, discovers root causes, curate requirements and user stories, and maintains a spotlight on business value opportunities in support of investment justification, planning, and execution.

Manages Stakeholder Experiences: Generates rich and insightful stakeholder and sponsor assessments to manage expectations and advise on anticipated challenge and impedance in the delivery of IT services and capabilities.

Constructively Advocates for Value: Represents the "voice of the customer" and ensures project delivery teams are well informed to make the right trade-offs between speed, quality, and cost. Connects the business stakeholders with the broader IT services. Supports identification of value opportunities across the entire lifecycle of the digital investments.

Enables Compelling Business Cases: Aids in the development of business cases for new digital capability investments. Identifies, defines, & measures business outcomes for highest value digital capabilities.

Brings an External View: Actively maintains awareness of external drivers in the business domain and relevant technology trends and brings innovative ideas.

Leverages Cross-Organizational Relationships: Ensures that all IT functions are successful in their delivery of services to SMDD, PCO, NCS/VS, and MoCR.

Influences Service Providers and Delivery Teams: Understands IT business partner accountabilities throughout the portfolio lifecycle and builds empowered and trusting partnerships with IT delivery team members at all levels.

Knows what Value Looks Like: Translates business needs into specific business requirements, sees realistic opportunities for IT to add more value, and informs IT peers to assist their understanding of “fitness for purpose.”

Communicates Effectively: Organizes and presents complex ideas in a simple, convincing, and compelling manner; able to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical teams. Influences change management strategies in support of capability establishment.

Shows Good Judgement in Communication: Communicates successes and issues accurately, urgently, and to the right audience, and takes accountability for ensuring effective management of expectations with IT peers and business stakeholders.

Boldly Acts with Urgency: Shows courage, tenacity, and respect to provoke uncomfortable conversations in order to remove roadblocks to value delivery.

Expresses a Growth Mindset: Demonstrates a passion for skillset development within Business Relationship Management, Business Analysis, and the Pharmaceutical scientific domain.

Advances Our Business Analysis Practice: Ability to bring in mature, impactful, and sustainable business analysis behaviors that drive change and deliver value.

Desired Experience:

B.S., M.S., or Ph.D. in a relevant scientific or technical domain preferred.

Relevant expertise in the application of IT capabilities to drive business value in a relevant domain.

Track record of leading the analysis of complex and ambiguous business needs and integrating those needs into compelling and actionable strategic plans and investment business cases with broad reach and impact.

Track record of delivering high-value digital capability projects within timelines and budget.

5+ years of progressive information technology experience, with responsibility for scientific application analysis, design, or support.

Strong collaboration, communication, and presentation skills.

Demonstrated commitment to creative thinking and application of innovative approaches within a relevant scientific domain.

Working knowledge of agile methodologies applied to SDLC and IT services.

IIBA Certification or similar Business Analysis Certification, a strong plus.

Experience with computer system validation in a regulated environment a plus.

Division Overview:

Aurobindo Pharma USA, Inc. is a generic pharmaceutical manufacturer and distributor and is a wholly owned subsidiary of Aurobindo Pharma Limited, a leading generic pharmaceutical company based in India. Headquartered in HITEC City, Hyderabad, India, founded in 1986 and becoming a public company in India in 1992.

Aurobindo Pharma USA, Inc. is committed to delivering a broad portfolio of quality, affordable generic pharmaceuticals to pharmacists and patients. Aurobindo Pharma USA, Inc. adds value through superior customer service in the distribution of a broad line of generic pharmaceuticals, leveraging vertical integration and efficient controlled processes. Aurobindo has business operations in more than 125 countries around the world. Aurobindo is a global pharmaceutical company with a broad portfolio of generic drugs that includes more than 180 product families and 450 individual product packages.


Aurobindo markets over 80% of the top 100 most prescribed products in the world. In past years, Aurobindo has received more ANDA approvals than any of our competitors.
Job Overview:
Manage large data sets using excel, access, cloud, etc. Design, analyze, and distribute monthly reports and dashboards for use by executives in sales/commercial business decisions. Assist in managing SalesForce.com system/process.

Description

When you come to work for New Jersey Judiciary you will join an 8500-member strong TEAM that operates with the highest standards of independence, integrity, fairness and quality service. You will be engaged with work that has purpose, meaning and makes a difference in lives of the public we serve. We work hard every day to build the public’s trust and confidence in our court system, which includes issues such as bail reform, marijuana decriminalization and recovery court. Whether it be in a courtroom, an administrative office, a courthouse training room, an IT office or in the field, our Judiciary workforce is improving the lives of countless individuals and families every day. We honor the dignity and individualism of each member of our organization while fostering professionalism and continuous improvement in our work.

SALARY: The salary range for this position is $56,859.22 to $93,632.72 for Schedule A, and $56,859.22 to $88,951.08 for Schedule B. For newly hired individuals, the starting salary will normally be at the minimum of the salary range. For current Judiciary employees, salary upon promotion or advancement will be an increase of 5% of base salary, not to exceed the maximum of the range, or the minimum salary of the band/level, whichever is greater. Judiciary employees hired prior to June 3, 2014, are considered Schedule A. Newly hired individuals, and Judiciary employees hired on or after June 3, 2014, are considered Schedule B.

The Judiciary offers a strong opportunity for growth.

The New Jersey Judiciary is seeking a professional business analyst to work under the general direction of the chief or other supervisory personnel in the Automated Trial Court Services Unit (ATCSU). This unit is primarily responsible for business analysis and user requirements gathering; workflow analysis; development of project plans; user interface; system testing; and user training and support. The unit works collaboratively with court case processing managers and staff, information technology managers and staff, and others to plan and implement large scale Judiciary information technology projects. It also provides ongoing customer support for applications and delivers presentations, when necessary, to various customers located throughout the state. Experience with all stages of the SDLC, PEGA and Agile methodology is preferred.

REMOTE WORK: The Judiciary currently offers a hybrid work schedule, and this position may qualify for up to 3 days of remote work outside of Judiciary buildings. To participate in this program, you will be required to have high speed home internet access.

Example of Duties

Writing specifications for new applications and enhancements
Recommending process and design changes to case management systems
Defining and documenting customer business functions and processes
Communicating and collaborating with external and internal customers to analyze information needs and functional requirements
Developing business requirements documents (e.g., user stories, data matrix, security matrix, UI designs, screen-flow diagrams, wireframes & user interface specification documentation)
Developing test scripts and performing a variety of system and user testing across multiple platforms
Preparing and conducting presentations or training sessions to internal and external customers (including judges, court staff, attorneys, and other governmental entities)
Creating training materials and system documentation (e.g., user guides, quick reference guides, release notes, training videos)
Providing helpdesk and on-site user support
Performing other related duties as required
The selected candidate(s) may be required to work a non-traditional work week, which may include weekends and holidays.

Qualifications

Graduation from an accredited college or university with a Bachelor's Degree in a field related to computer science, information technology or the area to which the applicant is applying, such as information systems, human-computer interaction, interactive media, software engineering, computer networking, and/or cybersecurity.

Substitution: Applicants who do not possess the required education may substitute additional paraprofessional and/or professional IT technical experience or experience related to the area to which the applicant is applying on a year for year basis with one year of such experience being equal to 30 semester hour credits.

A Bachelor's Degree in any field from an accredited college or university and one (1) year of additional paraprofessional and/or professional IT technical experience or experience related to the area to which the applicant is applying may be substituted for the required education.

An Associate's Degree in a field related to computer science, information technology or the area to which the applicant is applying, such as information systems, human-computer interaction, interactive media, software engineering, computer networking, and/or cybersecurity and two (2) years of additional paraprofessional and/or professional IT technical experience or experience related to the area to which the applicant is applying may be substituted for a the required education.

An Associate's Degree in any field from an accredited college or university and three years of additional paraprofessional and/or professional IT technical experience or experience related to the area to which the applicant is applying may be substituted for the required education.

A Master's Degree in a field related to computer science, information technology or the area to which the applicant is applying, such as information systems, human-computer interaction, interactive media, software engineering, computer networking, and/or cybersecurity may be substituted for the required education.

Applicants who are approaching their anticipated graduation date may apply. If selected, the applicant must complete their degree no later than their start date.

Education Note: Degrees conferred outside of the United States must be evaluated by a recognized evaluation service.(See www.naces.org/members.html)

Supplemental Information

Physical Ability: For some positions, applicants must have the ability to perform work which requires climbing and prolonged standing, stretching, bending and reaching. The selected candidate must be able to frequently lift and carry supplies weighing from 30 to 50 pounds and, occasionally, materials weighing up to 75 pounds.

Driver's License: Appointee will be required to possess a driver's license valid in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle is necessary to perform essential duties of the position.

Authorization to Work: US citizenship is not required. Selected candidate must be authorized to work in the US according to Department of Homeland Security, US Citizenship and Immigration Services regulations.

Special Note: Newly hired employees must agree to a thorough background check that will include fingerprinting. All data received will be kept in strict confidence except to inform the individual of the findings and what action will be taken as a result of this information.

Residency Law: In accordance with N.J.S.A. 52:14-7 (L. 2011, Chapter 70), the "New Jersey First Act," all persons newly hired by the Judiciary within one year must establish, and then maintain, principal residence in the State of New Jersey. Any person may request an exemption from that requirement from the Employee Residency Review Committee in the Department of Labor & Workforce Development on the basis of either hardship or employer critical need.

HOW TO APPLY:

The NJ Judiciary requires all applicants to complete the application process fully and as instructed. All applicants must complete the work experience and education sections and attach any required documents. Applications must describe all relevant work experience in detail, beginning with your current or most recent job, including military service (indicate rank), internships and job-related volunteer work, if applicable. Use a separate section to describe each position. Applicants who indicate "see resume" or enter their initials to acknowledge that they have skipped the Work History and Education sections will not be considered, unless they do not possess any education history or work experience. Only applicants that follow the application instructions and submit completed applications will be considered.

The New Jersey Judiciary consists of: the Supreme Court, the Superior Court including the Appellate Division and the Trial Court of the 15 vicinages in New Jersey, the Tax Court and the Municipal Court System. The Administrative Office of the Courts provides technical assistance, operational support, training, research and development, budget and personnel coordination, and development and operation of information systems for the Courts of New Jersey.


The Judiciary of New Jersey is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action
Employer Committed to Ensuring an Open Door to Justice

Calling all innovators – find your future at Fiserv.

We’re Fiserv, a global leader in Fintech and payments, and we move money and information in a way that moves the world. We connect financial institutions, corporations, merchants, and consumers to one another millions of times a day – quickly, reliably, and securely. Any time you swipe your credit card, pay through a mobile app, or withdraw money from the bank, we’re involved. If you want to make an impact on a global scale, come make a difference at Fiserv.

Job Title

Business Analyst

What does a great Business Analyst do?

As a Business Analyst on the Money Network team, you will play an integral role in a variety of initiatives to support strategic business objectives. You will generate meaningful insights through fact-based analysis to ultimately improve client satisfaction and financial results.

If you are analytically driven and enjoy lighting up a room with thoughtful insights, this position will bring purpose to your passion!

As a Business Analyst, you can look forward to supporting the team by:

Critically thinking through, sometimes vague, business issues and how to analyze them efficiently
Performing analyses to support key business initiatives and synthesizing key insights that can turn into actions.
Prepare and deliver communications that share insights within Money Network and beyond.
Develop and maintain daily and monthly metric dashboards and reporting packages
Develop business cases, using quantitative and non-quantitative data, for strategic initiatives to improve the client experience and Fiserv financials.

Basic qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree
Proactive self-starter with a dynamic and resilient nature, high degree of adaptability and flexibility to excel in a dynamic fast-paced environment
Ability to work independently, prioritize tasks and solve problems
Must have strong data analytics and problem-solving skills
Proficient in MS Office Tools, with advanced Excel skills
Experience querying data from data warehouses and relational databases

Learn more about Fiserv:

To support the total well-being of our associates, Fiserv takes a broad approach to our benefits. Job Summary

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Business Analyst to join our dynamic team. The Business Analyst will play a crucial role in analyzing business processes, identifying areas for improvement, and proposing innovative solutions to enhance efficiency and productivity. The ideal candidate should possess strong analytical skills, excellent communication abilities, and a deep understanding of business operations and technologies, and will work in an agile environment of product, design, and technical partners to increase adoption, value, and drive operational efficiencies for our clients.

Responsibilities

Requirement Analysis:

Collaborate with stakeholders to gather, document, and analyze business requirements.
Conduct thorough research and data analysis to understand industry trends and best practices.
Translate business requirements into clear and concise functional specifications.

Process Improvement:

Identify inefficiencies and bottlenecks in existing processes and propose optimized solutions.
Work closely with cross-functional teams to streamline workflows and enhance operational efficiency.
Develop and implement process improvement strategies to drive business growth.

Data Analysis:

Analyze large datasets to extract valuable insights and trends.
Prepare detailed reports and visualizations to communicate findings to stakeholders.
Utilize statistical methods and tools to interpret complex data sets.

Systems Integration:

Collaborate with IT teams to ensure seamless integration of new systems and applications.
Conduct system testing and validation to guarantee accurate and efficient functionality.
Troubleshoot and resolve integration issues in a timely manner.

Project Management:

Assist in project planning, monitoring project progress, and ensuring timely completion of tasks.
Provide regular updates to project stakeholders on milestones, risks, and challenges.
Support project managers in coordinating activities across various departments.

Stakeholder Communication:

Act as a bridge between technical and non-technical stakeholders, ensuring clear communication of requirements and project objectives.
Conduct presentations and workshops to explain complex concepts and proposed solutions to diverse audiences.

Requirements

Proven experience as a Business Analyst or similar role.
Experience with business process modeling and workflows, and process improvement.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a keen attention to detail.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and techniques.
Technical systems and process-oriented mindset.
Project management certifications such as PMP are desirable.

JOB SUMMARY: We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Market Research Analyst to join our team. As a Market Research Analyst, you will be responsible for collecting and analyzing data to provide valuable insights that guide our company's strategic decisions. You will play a pivotal role in understanding market trends, customer preferences, and competitive landscapes to help drive business growth.

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS: The list of essential functions, as outlined herein, is intended to be representative of the tasks performed within this classification. It is not necessarily descriptive of any one position in the class. The omission of an essential function does not preclude management from assigning duties not listed herein if such duties are a logical assignment to the position.

Data Collection: Gather data from various sources, including surveys, customer interviews, industry reports, and online databases.

• Data Analysis: Analyze data to identify market trends, market dynamics, consumer behavior, and competitive activity. Use statistical tools and software to interpret findings.

• Competitive Analysis: Assess competitors' strengths and weaknesses, market positioning, and pricing strategies to inform our competitive advantage.

• Market Segmentation: Identify target customer segments and develop strategies for reaching them effectively. Identifies potential new products or markets through research.

• Consumer Insights: Extract insights into customer preferences, needs, and behavior to guide product development and marketing strategies.

Industry Data: Ability to read and interpret industry data and develop strong insights and takeaways on emerging trends or shifts in the market.

• Ad-Hoc Research: Handle ad-hoc research and reporting requests, including in-depth analysis and problem-solving.

• Cross-Functional Collaboration: Collaborate with multiple end-user groups, including finance, accounting, marketing, and business operations, to lead cross-functional projects and develop reporting and analysis programs.

• Reporting Development: Design, develop, and deliver accurate, fast, and interactive reporting to key business stakeholders. Summarizes and analyzes data; makes recommendations related to research findings. Create and standardize the report request process, tracking requests and working with firmwide leadership on prioritization, approvals, and rollouts.

• Trend Identification: Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets. Forecasts and tracks industry marketing and sales trends based on collected data.

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential duties

OTHER JOB FUNCTIONS & RESPONSIBILITIES: The below statements are intended to describe the general nature and scope of work being performed by this position. This is not a complete listing of all responsibilities and/or duties required. Other duties may be assigned.

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:

• Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Market Research, Marketing, Business, or related field

Five years experience in finance, strategy, pricing, market research, data analysis, or a related role, or
A combination of education and work experience

DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS:

Proficiency in data analysis tools, such as SPSS, Excel, or statistical software.
Extensive experience and proficiency with PowerPoint.
Strong analytical, critical thinking, presentation, and problem-solving skills.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Detail-oriented with the ability to manage and prioritize multiple tasks under quick deadlines.
Knowledge of market research methodologies and best practices.
Experience with data visualization tools like Tableau or Power BI.
Familiarity with survey design and analysis.
Knowledge of primary and secondary research methods.
Understanding of digital marketing and online consumer behavior.
Accurate, flexible, detail oriented, highly ethical and have proven ability to handle confidential information appropriately.

WORK ENVIRONMENT: Hybrid arrangement (3 days in office)

DIRECT REPORTS: No Direct Reports

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS: Please see below:

Regularly required to sit and stand
Occasionally will lift items up to 10 lbs

About the Department

The Clinical, Medical and Regulatory (CMR) department at Novo Nordisk is one of the most diverse and collaborative groups within the organization. From health-care-provider interactions and developing and implementing regulatory strategies with the FDA to providing medical education and collecting data to support efficacy and new product development, CMR is involved. The one thing that keeps us all marching to the same beat is our patient-centered focus. At Novo Nordisk, you will help patients around the world. As their needs evolve, so does our challenge to find better and more innovative ways to improve their quality of life. We’re changing lives for a living. Are you ready to make a difference?


The Position

The Lead Data Scientist identifies and delivers dynamic and reliable analytics products and services by leveraging internal and external data to enable faster decision making across Novo Nordisk; and contributes to the growth, competitiveness, and innovation of the company. Acts as an internal analytics consultant to understand the needs of stakeholders, build strategic relationships, and develop/implement innovative solutions that address the needs of the business.


Relationships

This position reports the head of Clinical Data Analytics & Modeling (CDAM) and functions as an analytics specialist in the Clinical Data Science & Evidence (CDSE) department. Collaborates closely with teams in departments throughout the organization, including Medical Affairs, HEOR, Clinical Trial Management, Market Development & HCP Engagement, as well as with other data science units globally. May also mentor Analytics interns and oversee projects with external vendors. Oversees projects with external vendors.


Essential Functions

Contributes to the development and delivery of novel and innovative analytics solutions and services (analysis, data visualization,) in response to client requests. Understands client needs and readily customizes deliverables to address key business needs
Explores and introduces new data driven approaches to generate business insights in order to address unanswered business problems
Understands and incorporates analytics best practices and keeps on top of emerging tools and practices. Leads the development of new and creative analytics solutions that will become part of our core deliverables. Ability to quickly understand new concepts and implement novel designs to advanced data science problems
Understands stakeholder needs; demonstrates thorough understanding of data and directs data preparation activities
Validates, interprets and presents data findings to key stakeholders. Translates data analysis into a meaningful story that explains nuance and complexity, and inspires action
Works closely with key stakeholders to understand current issues, anticipate future needs, and determine potential solutions
Communicates to ensure efficient knowledge sharing and collaboration within CMR Operations and often with other departments in CMR
Participates in the development of new standards and/or practices. Applies analytical capability and insight to tasks to build support for new standards and/or practices across departments
Collaborates with other team members to ensure overall integration of products and services. Contributes to completion of information analytics projects; participates in planning and coordination of projects
Develops network of internal relationships. Participates in projects locally and/or globally, and across CMR


Physical Requirements

10-20% overnight travel required.


Qualifications


Relevant technical education at B.Sc. level, advanced degree may be substituted for experience as appropriate

Advanced degree in Information Science (MIS), Mathematics, Engineering, Statistics (MS) or related field (MS) preferred

6 years of experience ideal from relevant industry such as clinical trials, pharmaceutical, consulting, life sciences or technology research

Expertise in interpreting and explaining data trends

Experience with cloud analytics platforms & tools (i.e., AWS platform & services, R, Python, SQL, etc.)

Excellent organizational, communication, and presentation skills

Advanced skills in information visualization concepts and tools


We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants.


At Novo Nordisk we recognize that it is no longer good enough to aspire to be the best company in the world. We need to aspire to be the best company for the world and we know that this is only possible with talented employees with diverse perspectives, backgrounds and cultures. We are therefore committed to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates the diversity of our employees, the patients we serve and communities we operate in. Together, we’re life changing.

Position Summary:

The Quality Data Analyst role is responsible for all aspects of user acceptance testing and the quality assurance lifecycle pertaining to the HealthCare industry. This includes end to end accountability to test the quality of the user experience through visual inspection and functional testing against established QA principles, methodology and guidelines. The Quality Data Analyst will also be required to create manual test cases, execute test scripts and participate in defect remediation.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:




Participation in requirement sessions.
Ability to understand the business context and underlying processes, comprehend data requirements, and to correlate them to data.

Expertise with acquiring data from multiple data source types i.e. Transactional and Data warehouse systems. Identify critical data entities and attributes
Must be comfortable interpreting data models to build data joins & associations, data wrangling and data manipulation techniques
Work with large datasets, review for data inaccuracies based on stated data requirements and provide feedback to the business and technology teams
Work closely with Data engineering and Business Intelligence teams to help identify data, dashboard, report anomalies. Guide in quick resolution
Must have worked in a data-centric environment where large volumes of data are queried for analysis
Experience with working with reporting/analytical tools like Qlik, Tableau, Power BI is big plus
Development of test plans and test scripts based on requirement specifications.
Test plan implementation and script execution.
Drive BI testing including Functional Testing, Data Validation, System Integration, Automated testing.
Defect tracking/remediation.

JOB OVERVIEW


The QA Analyst will conduct Quality Assurance audits of production facilities and processes, assuring company standards are maintained and product integrity is preserved. They will make recommendations on how to better improve quality, production, and efficiency problems. The QA Analyst will function as an information source to production and various company departments when special and critical quality issues occur.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES




Follow PIM Brands GMP rules
Work closely with the SQFP and QA Manager to ensure compliance with Food Quality and Safety Programs.
Assist Quality Department in organization and maintenance of quality documents as well as special projects as dictated by QA Manager
Review records, inspect documents for accuracy, and maintain documentation manuals (i.e. request and follow-up on supplier documentation, etc.) to ensure they are up to date.
Assists in the preparation of SOP's for new and existing products developed.
Document technical information for plant management team.
Devise sampling procedures and parameters for recording and reporting quality data.
Prepare reports to communicate outcomes of quality activities.
Report food safety and quality issues to Plant management and SQFP
Monitor fellow employees for adherence to GMPs.
Support internal and external audit activities by conducting facility inspections in the manufacturing facility and follow-up on corrective actions
Review the implementation and efficiency of quality and inspection systems.
Collect and compile statistical quality data from findings
Analyze data to identify areas for improvement in the quality system
Discuss plant evaluations with plant management, make appropriate recommendations and set timetable for improvement and corrections.
Prepare plant evaluation reports and submit them to Manager, Quality Assurance Services.
Assist with investigation and documentation of process deviations.
Gathering, analyzing and reporting on consumer complaint data.


Assist with investigations based on consumer feedback (adverse events, complaints) and implementation of corrective and preventive actions.
Actively participate in preparations for third party and customer compliance audit.
Update forms, records and SOPs and maintain document register.
Assist in the validation of processes, equipment and operating procedures.
Perform routine document and facility food safety and quality audits.
Preparing report, charts, graphs and presentations.
Working with cross-functional teams to resolve and track implementation of changes.
Analyze and determine trends in data sets and identify where actions are required based on the data

PHYSICAL DEMANDS/ ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS

Standing, walking, sitting, bending, reaching, kneeling and crouching. Manual dexterity of hands and fingers to handle or feel objects, tools and controls. Lifting and moving of objects weighing at least 30 lbs. Reasonable accommodations will be evaluated and considered to enable an individual to perform the essential job functions.


WORK ENVIRONMENT


Job will generally be performed in the manufacturing plant. When on the plant floor it is representative of a large, busy manufacturing operation. Noisy, active, objects on the floor, constant movement and traffic flow of motorized equipment. Hair net, beard net, assigned work uniform, protective eye wear and gloves are among the GMP required apparel that must be worn, if indicated, on the plant floor.

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE

Bachelors Degree in chemistry, Biology, Microbiology or Food Science preferred
Certifications an advantage including Quality Auditor, Quality Improvement Associate, HACCP, SQF.
Two - four years experience in field, laboratory, or production facility quality control
Quality inspection, auditing and testing experience.
Experience with implementation of corrective action programs.
Strong computer skills including Microsoft Office and databases
Knowledge of tools, concepts and methodologies of QA
Knowledge of relevant regulatory requirements

Job Description: Information Security Analyst


The Information Security Analyst will function as an internal IT resource for the organization. The position will work in the security and compliance team and report directly to the CIO. Candidate will work with various departments to maintain compliance and strengthen the organization’s security posture.


Principle Functions:

Security Engineering Principles
Coordinate with Infrastructure, Software, Technical Support, Professional Service Teams and end users to minimize disruptions and protect assets
Configure and analyze security tools and software
Review daily and periodic data to identify, report, and remedy vulnerabilities
Risk Management
Help develop solutions or improvements to prevent malicious activity
Use technical skills to help respond to threats and emergency security incidents in a timely manner
Use knowledge of computers and electronics to monitor and analyze data from various security systems
Internal Security Measures
Security planning, design, and implementation
Effectively communicate security information to fellow analysts, employees, and / or customers

Secure Engineering Technical Management
Managing and overseeing all technical security initiatives

Education / Experience

Education
Background in Computer Science, Information Technically, or related field is strongly preferred
Certifications
Existing certification or in pursuit to certify is strongly preferred:
CISA
CISM
CGEIT
CRISC
CDPSE
CSX-P


Essential Experience

The Information Security Analyst should have an Information Technology Background with at least 2 years in a security role.

Excellent written communication skills
Excellent organization skills
Knowledge and experience of HiTrust and security compliance

The candidate must be a professional and team oriented individual with the ability to problem solve by thinking “outside of the box”, remain calm and contain composure during high pressure or chaotic situations, and have good judgement to escalate or deescalate when needed. The candidate must exhibit eager and willingness to add to their knowledgebase/skills and grow professionally. The candidate should possess the following qualities:



Authentic, passionate, and driven
Integrity (honest, sincere, respectful, trustworthy, ethical)
Good judgment (using both reasoning and intuition)
Excellence (high performance standards, continuous improvement, outstanding organization and attention to detail and accuracy, strong work ethic)
Good interpersonal maturity and teamwork
Proactive
Adaptable

This role will also work closely with cross-functional teams to understand business needs, identify trends, and develop actionable recommendations across multiple pre-sale and post-sale applications.




Responsibilities include:




Collect and analyze large datasets from various sources to identify patterns, trends, and relationships. Develop and maintain data models, dashboards, and reports to monitor key performance indicators (KPIs). Contribute to the development of data governance standards.
Collaborate with teams across the organization to understand their data needs and provide analytical support. Identify opportunities for process improvements and efficiency gains through data analysis.
Use statistical techniques and data visualization tools to present findings in a clear and meaningful way to stakeholders. Conduct ad hoc data analysis and research to address specific business questions or challenges.
Work directly with other IT members on data and/or application related projects.
Stay updated with industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in data analysis.

Required Qualifications:




Bachelor’s degree in data science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field
Proven experience as a Data Analyst or similar role, with a strong track record of delivering insights and solutions from data and establishing data governance standards
Exhibit proficiency in SQL for data retrieval and manipulation, and experience with SQL Server management studio
Familiarity with database systems and data warehousing concepts
Demonstrate a proactive and collaborative mindset with the ability to work both independently and in a team environment
2+ years of working experience in a fast-paced, data driven manufacturing/distributor organization
Proficiency in data analysis and visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, Excel, Phyton, and R
Ability to effectively communicate complex findings and technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders



Preferred Qualifications:




2+ years working experience with Microsoft D365 Finance & Operations and Customer Engagement (Sales hub) or Microsoft AX 2012
2+ Years SQL experience
Cloud experience
HTML experience

The Plymouth Rock Company and its affiliated group of companies write and manage over $1.8 billion in personal and commercial auto and homeowner’s insurance throughout the Northeast and mid-Atlantic, where we have built an unparalleled reputation for service. Job Title: Specialty Payments Business Analyst - Accounts Payable
Job Description:
Since 1869 we've connected people through food they love. Our history was created by remarkable people, ideas, and innovations. It serves as inspiration and foundation for our future success. We’re proud to be stewards of amazing brands that people trust. We foster a culture of belonging where people come first, and diversity is embraced. And we live our values, always, while setting the highest standards for performance.
Here, you will make a difference every day. You will be part of a dynamic, collaborative, and competitive team. You will be supported to build a rewarding career with opportunities to grow, innovate and inspire. Make history with us.
What role will you play? How will you make history with Campbell’s? Apply today!
General Summary
The Specialty Payments Business Analyst will support and maintain the customer payments activities as well as be a back-up to the Travel & Expense Business Analyst. This position will assist with several specialty payment allowances and work on a team with 3 other employees at WHQ in Camden, NJ. The job includes setting up several SAP rebates along with establishing ACH payments for customers by working with the master data team and internal business partners. The analyst will review and approve invoices to be paid to our brokers and review manual rebate accruals on a monthly basis. Monthly reconciliations will be reviewed for the broker payments to ensure there are no differences and if so, research accordingly.
Primary Responsibilities
30% - Work with master data to set up rebates in SAP for a variety of specialty payment allowances per the business requirements, make changes timely when needed as well as calculate any missed allowances. Final settle rebates on a semi-annual basis.
10% - Assist with the specialty payment allowances process (mostly for broker commissions) and review the monthly payment logs to ensure completeness and process broker invoices timely upon receipt.
10% - Broker control report monthly reconciliations across several business units.
5% - Work on iDoc errors associated with E4 payments (trade system).
15% - Assist with various Travel & Expense payments and be a back-up when required.
10% - Handle returned check/ACH payments and mail checks to customers that require special handling via FedEx.
10% - Set up ACH payments for customers that would like to receive their payments electronically.
5% - Assist in projects as they arise.
5% - Prepare journal entries at month-end.
Complexity & Scope
Set-up and maintain all rebates for specialty payment allowances.
Review the payment exceptions for payments that failed.
Review and update payment logs.
Assist with various business requests to provide payment information.
Handle mailing of checks or customer refund deposits.
Monthly review of the broker commission process and various research when requested by broker.
Documentation and updates of desk-top procedures.
Work on special projects as they arise.
Minimum Requirements
Associates or Bachelor’s Degree required.
5+ years of accounts payable experience is required, and knowledge of SAP rebate functionality is a plus.
Must possess good customer service and problem-solving skills.
Ability to prioritize and work independently as well as work on urgent issues when they arise throughout the workday.
Some accounting background is preferred.
Excellent attention to detail and ability to follow through to resolution on issues.
Ability to communicate effectively and establish value-added working relationships with internal and external customers.
Software: Must have a working knowledge of Microsoft products and knowledge of SAP rebate functionality is a plus.

Immunization Requirements

Under Policy 60.1.35 Immunization Policy for Rutgers Employees and Prospective Employees, Rutgers University requires all prospective employees to provide proof that they are vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to commencement of employment, unless the University has granted the individual a medical or religious exemption. Rutgers University may require certain prospective employees to receive an updated (bivalent) vaccine dose. Under Policy 100.3.1 Immunization Policy for Covered Individuals, if employment will commence during Flu Season, Rutgers University may require certain prospective employees to provide proof that they are vaccinated against Seasonal Influenza for the current Flu Season, unless the University has granted the individual a medical or religious exemption. Additional infection control and safety policies may apply. Prospective employees should speak with their hiring manager to determine which policies apply to the role or position for which they are applying. Develop and enhance data collection processes
