HR Business and Data analyst

Scope

This HR Business and Data analyst role provides administrative support to the HR Leaders of the North America Field and the Westchester, a Chubb Company groups. in the Whitehouse Station, New Jersey office. The ideal candidate needs to be able to manage relationships at all levels of the organization and must also be flexible and collaborative. This role dually reports to 2 different SVP, HR Leaders.


Major Duties and Responsibilities:

Maintains a proactive diary of items, including proactive support and follow up on items as needed.
Creates spreadsheets for NA Field and Wholesale, filters and send Requisition and Candidate Reports to respective HR Teams.
Provide extra support during compensation season and process transactions in the comp tool.
Assist in the Circle of Excellence process, create forms, collect information, and update the year-to-year honorees spreadsheet.
Maintains Talent Review and Succession Planning decks and update as necessary.
Participates in and provides administrative support on special projects and events and reporting.
Provides customer service to internal and external customers and employees.
Coordinates or manages programs and projects as assigned (Take Your Child To Work Day).
Assists HR Benefits team and process leave of absence transactions.
Assist other areas of HR as needed.
Demonstrates expertise with the Oracle Cloud HCM system and report running
Serves as a backup to other assistants in HR.
Maintains updated org charts.
Aid with all WHS HR inquiries, respond to Ad-Hoc requests, create service request when there is an issue, EE move, or in need of space. (Partner with Facilities team/Workplace experience coordinator)
Performs administrative duties of a highly confidential nature.
Manages calendar; coordinates travel arrangements; prepares detailed travel itineraries, coordinates flights, accommodations, dining and ground transportation; processes expense reports and reconciles and tracks monthly credit card statements and expenditures.
Creates and transcribes correspondence and communications, including memos, letters, charts, Excel spreadsheets etc.
Schedules and organizes meetings often involving numerous participants, coordinates conference calls, webcasts and other events, including technology, attendees, presenters, agenda and associated meeting materials, and distribution of materials prior to and following meetings.
Performs administrative analyses which require a degree of independent decision making.
Creates effective presentations and assists in research as needed.
Responds to regularly occurring requests for information.

Competencies/Technical Skills:

5+ years of demonstrated competence in HR and Data analysis
Professionalism and a demonstrated ability to handle confidential information
Displayed ability to take initiative and foresight to anticipate needs
Self-starter with a can-do attitude able to manage in a fast-paced environment
Ability to deal with ambiguities and shifting priorities
Demonstrated ability to work independently with limited supervision
Advanced proficiency in MS Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Outlook and Microsoft Teams. Willingness to learn new applications as required
Advanced proficiency with Oracle Cloud HCM system and reporting strongly preferred.
Experience with Concur, Visier and Medallia systems preferred
Strong written and verbal communication skills and proven ability to build relationships internally and externally.
Strong time management, planning, budgeting and organizing skills
Strong analytical skills
Ability to partner with remote leaders.

FirstEnergy at a Glance

We are a forward-thinking electric utility powered by a diverse team of employees committed to making customers’ lives brighter, the environment better and our communities stronger.

FirstEnergy (NYSE: FE) is dedicated to integrity, safety, reliability and operational excellence. Headquartered in Akron, Ohio, FirstEnergy includes one of the nation's largest investor-owned electric systems, more than 24,000 miles of transmission lines that connect the Midwest and Mid-Atlantic regions, and a regulated generating fleet with a total capacity of more than 3,500 megawatts.

About the Opportunity

This is an open position with Jersey Central Power & Light, a subsidiary of FirstEnergy Corp. [JCPL]

The Business Analyst - Capital Portfolio conducts data mining, data interpretation and disseminating information to the leadership team for review and analysis. The business analyst works closely with stakeholders to identify goals, best practices, and other active methods for gathering and analyzing data as it relates to the needs of the organization.

This individual provides statistical insights that help the decision-making process and align capital and resource allocation within the business budget. The business analyst drives fresh initiatives for safety, financial planning and business data utilization and identifies business areas that can be improved for safety performance, increased efficiency, and strengthen business processes. The business analyst works closely with others throughout state operations to communicate their findings and helps implement changes to support state model objectives.

This is a mobile position and can be sited at one of multiple New Jersey locations.

Responsibilities include :

Compiling and interpreting data, from various resources, in a concise and professional manner
Developing charts, tables, presentations, and other elements of data visualization
Identifying and prioritizing the organization's functional and technical needs and requirements
Creating models and reports to support business decisions
Understanding business strategies, goals, and requirements
Forecasting, budgeting, and performing both variance analysis and financial analysis
Supporting other business units with data requests; Workforce Development, Business Services
Building respectful and effective working relationships with state leaders and key stakeholders in multiple business units to work collaboratively on various requests and initiatives
Collaborating with state leaders on various data requests and providing interpretation
Describing opportunities and solutions for the business model
Timely responding to requests
Providing storm support, as required, including off-hours, weekends, and holidays
Delivering quality and accurate work within established deadlines

Qualifications

Two-to-four-year degree in Business, Finance, Accounting, Economics, Engineering or related discipline and minimum 4 years’ related work experience is required.
In lieu of a degree, minimum 7 years’ related work experience is required. Related work experience includes planning/analysis, performance reporting, forecasting, and budgeting.
A solid understanding of Microsoft Office applications – pivot tables, vlookups, filtering
Strong computer application experience in the Microsoft suite; PowerPoint, Excel, and Word
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to interpret and communicate data
Excellent analytical abilities
Able to work well under pressure, manage multiple priorities and projects
Able to build strong working relationships to support leaders and business units
Understanding of regulatory reporting requirements
Knowledge of Key Performance Indicators (KPI’s)
Apply new technology to its fullest potential to reach operational process improvement goals
Model active learning through continuing to learn, develop breadth of knowledge, skills and perspective
Experience in utility operations preferred

If you’re a master problem-solver who is driven by managing people and budgets, working under firm deadlines, and exceeding organizational objectives, we want to hear from you. Apply today! Responsibilities: - Performs data analysis with regard to client requests and develop rules/methodologies for effective data management. - Extracts, analyze, massage, cleanse and update data from Oracle, Dun & Bradstreet, ZoomInfo, Salesforce.com and CSA web site analytics on a routine basis. - Analysis and validation of new Prospect records entered by sales into Salesforce.com. - Participates in ongoing decisions concerning data collections, methodology, best practices for ensuring accurate and clean data. - Effectively creates/runs reports and performs data extracts as requested by the business in a timely manner. - Analyzes data with standard statistical methods, interpret results and present results to company management as requested. - Maintains data integration between Salesforce.com and Oracle applications. - Liaison with 3rd party vendors like Dun & Bradstreet to analyze and maintain data worthiness. - Maintains Sales Territories, Hierarchies and Resources in appropriate systems. - Effectively analyze Sales Territories to help Market Leaders develop their sales coverage plan. -Accountable for maintaining a high level of customer service. Qualifications: - Bachelor's degree in a relevant field or equivalent experience required, plus 0 to 2 years of related experience. - Have a strong knowledge of Microsoft Office, Excel, Access, and Power BI applications. - Be detail oriented, articulate, and well-organized. - Possess strong communication, troubleshooting and follow-up skills. - Experience with Salesforce.com preferred. - Utilize project management and reporting skills to assist with departmental projects. - Ability to meet strict deadlines and work effectively under pressure - Must have the business acumen to work with technical and non-technical colleagues, sales personnel, various level of sales management and executive staff. Johnson & Johnson Financial Solutions & Technology (FS&T) is recruiting for a Lead Analyst, Enterprise Planning & Analytics Data Validation to execute key processes and deliverables related to the deployment of Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A) solutions under the SigniFi program. This role will be based in New Brunswick, NJ.

Caring for the world, one person at a time has inspired and united the people of Johnson & Johnson for over 130 years. We embrace research and science - bringing innovative ideas, products and services to advance the health and well-being of people.

Johnson & Johnson is the world's most comprehensive and broadly-based manufacturer of health care products, as well as a provider of related services, for the pharmaceutical and medtech markets. There are more than 250 Johnson & Johnson operating companies employing over 130,000 people and with products touching the lives of over a billion people every day, throughout the world. If you have the talent and desire to touch the world, Johnson & Johnson has the career opportunities to help make it happen.

Thriving on a diverse company culture, celebrating the uniqueness of our employees and committed to inclusion. Proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

The Lead Analyst will be responsible for ensuring end to end data flows between J&J systems. They will support the execution of the validation processes on large data sets and provide business knowledge during testing cycles. This role will ensure completeness, accuracy and validity of data flows to meet the business needs in the FP&A environment.

The successful candidate needs to have a broad understanding of the J&J Operating Model. Extensive knowledge of financial reporting and forecasting processes is also required as the team’s projects and initiatives will impact all finance employees globally who are engaged in financial planning and analysis.

Major Responsibilities:

Analyze data between various systems to ensure completeness, accuracy and validity
Participate in formal/informal testing cycles
Help shape the data validations strategy to maximize business value and ensure success for the SignFi journey
Drive continuous improvement of the data validation process in support of the overall finance technology strategy
Work with large datasets using tools such as SQL, Alteryx, Excel etc
Collaborate with cross-functional business leaders, ensuring tech solutions address business requirements
Effectively enable finance stakeholders to deliver business insights
Partner with teams across the SignFi project
Work across multiple J&J Sectors
QUALIFICATIONS
A minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree is required, preferably in Finance or Accounting
Strong record of finance, accounting or related business experience, within J&J Pharmaceutical/ Medtech Sector is preferable
Strong analytical, critical thinking, problem solving, and systems skills are required with some working knowledge of reporting and planning tools and applications such as SAP BI/BW, HANA, FDW, TM1, BRAVO, Anaplan, AFO, Tableau, Blackline, and Alteryx is preferable
Must be highly motivated, committed, effective and supportive team member, able to work independently, flexibly, quickly, and accurately under tight deadlines
The role may require up to 10% domestic and/or international travel, based on employee’s home location

The base pay range for this position is $88,000 - $142,600

Good storytelling starts with great listening. At Audible, that means each role and every project has our audience in mind. Because the same people who design, develop, and deploy our products also happen to use them. To us, that speaks volumes.

ABOUT THIS ROLE
In this key role, you will be at the forefront of shaping and advancing our Business Intelligence (BI) applications, primarily through the enhancement of our existing BI platform. Additionally, you will collaborate with various elements of our global data ecosystem. Working in close partnership with Global Analytics business stakeholders, your responsibilities will encompass the strategic planning, design, and execution of flexible BI solutions. These solutions will be designed with a strong emphasis on user-friendliness, fostering user adoption, and delivering actionable insights, all of which will contribute to optimizing our operational efficiency.

ABOUT YOU
You are programming specialist who will be actively engaged in the design, development, troubleshooting, debugging, evaluation, support, and enhancement of Business Intelligence platforms. Leveraging existing system architectures, you will extend the capabilities of these applications, leading to more streamlined business processes that, in turn, empower end users to excel in their tasks with increased effectiveness and efficiency.

As a Senior Programmer Analyst, you will...

Work closely with other teams and stakeholders, analyze source systems, define underlying data sources and transformation requirements, design suitable data models and document the design/specifications
Develop enterprise-level Business Intelligence (BI) applications by applying MicroStrategy best practices to fulfill operational needs, encompassing scalability, maintainability, security, reliability, extensibility, flexibility, and manageability
Develop solutions to meet operational requirements, with a focus on optimizing global access and delivering pertinent content. Create relevant objects to construct and sustain dynamic reports and data visualizations within BI Applications
Demonstrate passion for quality and productivity by use of efficient development techniques, standards and guidelines
Produce technical documentation to support data delivery development

ABOUT AUDIBLE
At Audible, we innovate and inspire through the power of voice. We're changing the narrative on storytelling. As a leading creator and provider of premium audio storytelling, we've redefined the ways people access, discover, and share stories. The stories we tell have the ability to transport and transform everyday moments into meaningful experiences and it's our people who make Audible's service possible. We're listeners, storytellers, and problem-solvers. Our perspectives and experiences power our ideas and come together in our mission to unleash the power of the spoken word. Audible offers a Hub+Home hybrid workplace model that gives employees flexibility between gathering in an Audible workspace (work from hub) and remote work (work from home). For more information, please visit adbl.co/hybrid.

Background & Purpose of the Job

Unilever is committed to supporting sustainability and providing our consumers around the world with the products they need to look good, feel good and get more out of life. Unilever IT is focused on delivering world class solutions, great service, and outstanding business value. As digitization changes the world around us, we are developing data experts, operational specialists and change leaders as key elements of Unilever’s future fit organization. The Marketing Technology Analyst will drive technology enablement of services across Unilever’s end-to-end marketing capabilities. This role is leading the data-driven marketing operations and analytics with a focus on consumer data and performance marketing. A strong emphasis is placed on executing integrated consumer experiences, utilizing automation, and contributing to a scalable operational framework. Strong influencing and communication skills will be required to succeed.

Who You Are & What You’ll Do

The North American Marketing Technology Analyst position is based in Englewood Cliffs, NJ and is responsible for operational excellence, vendor management, business partnering and strategic communication.

The role resides within the NA UniOps organization and requires an understanding of how marketing technology & data can accelerate business growth and be a differentiator. Areas of focus cover technology, data, and commerce. Through collaboration across the Consumer Technology team and partnering cross-functionally the role facilitates:

consumer experience design

marketing journey orchestration

campaign execution

performance analytics

automation

decision optimization (AI)

Your stakeholders are brand & shopper marketing teams, internal service leads and external agencies. You will be a champion for technology & innovation tapped to educate and share learnings. In this role, the right candidate will possess a challenger mindset, be consumer & shopper obsessed, and positively influence others.

Understand audience data (segments, traits, models, destinations)

Manage processes to/from various platforms such as Adobe Marketing Cloud, Epsilon PeopleCloud

Lead a/b tests and campaign optimization

Lead tag management

Monitor health of digital marketing channels

Identify actionable insights to optimize digital marketing channels

Evaluate opportunities to drive funnel conversion

Partner with other analysts & audience specialists to support best in-class marketing ecosystem and data infrastructure

Contribute to E2E reporting & data visualization via dashboards or one-off analyses

Assess data needs to support analysis and reporting

Collaborate with data scientists and AI leads to design use cases

Work with stakeholders to identify key metrics to evaluate marketing performance

Prioritize continuous improvement

Communicate how changes to processes/platforms drive business impact

You’re a born leader: This role has accountability for own work and project / stakeholder responsibilities. Receives assignments in the form of Objectives, and Key Results (OKRs) orchestrated across the Consumer Technology Tribe via an agile methodology. The ability to gain stakeholder consensus, build coalitions, and contribute to the organizational vision will be crucial for success.

You’re a dot connector: A willingness to develop an industry network and organizational awareness that harmonize services and operations. This role is responsible for technology delivery: demand management, execution, analytics, communications, and support.

You’re a changemaker: This position actively monitors technology trends and regularly identifies new and emerging technology opportunities. A passion for testing new ideas, automation, and creative solutions is essential.

You Drive High Performance Culture: Implement team & organizational design solutions; Drive on-going engagement initiatives.

You love to win, and have fun doing it: Your eye is always on the prize and you have a history of blowing away targets. You know it’s an adventure you need to celebrate along the way.

What You'll Need to Succeed

3+ years of experience in digital marketing analytics, personalization, and digital operations (ex. Business Analyst or Data Analyst role) Knowledge of analytics tools (Google or Adobe or other)

Knowledge of tag management solutions (Adobe Launch or other)

Passion for data, problem-solving and analysis

Knowledge of digital marketing tactics and performance benchmarks

Experience working with external technology partners Experience working across tech stacks and managing integrations

Experience with visualization tools a plus (DOMO, Power BI, Tableau)

Knowledge of CDPs and marketing cloud ecosystems a plus!

Knowledge of clean rooms Knowledge of Retail Media Networks a plus!

Experience with industry standard CMS and e-comm platforms Exposure to AdTech (DMPs, DSPs, Ad Servers, Exchanges) a plus!

Experience in data management practices; hands-on use of 1P, 2P and 3P data Must have ability to tackle complex situations, evaluate options, and provide informed solutions/recommendations a plus!

Understand the principles and execution of the agile methodology a plus!

Pay: The pay range for this position is $83,200 to $124,700. Unilever takes into consideration a wide range of factors that are utilized in making compensation decisions including, but not limited to, skill sets, experience and training, licensure and certifications, qualifications and education, and other business and organizational needs.

Bonus: This position is bonus eligible.

Long-Term Incentive (LTI): This position is LTI eligible.

Benefits: Unilever employees are eligible to participate in our benefits plan. Should the employee choose to participate, they can choose from a range of benefits to include, but is not limited to, health insurance (including prescription drug, dental, and vision coverage), retirement savings benefits, life insurance and disability benefits, parental leave, sick leave, paid vacation and holidays, as well as access to numerous voluntary benefits. Any coverages for health insurance and retirement benefits will be in accordance with the terms and conditions of the applicable plans and associated governing plan documents.

Calling all innovators – find your future at Fiserv.

We’re Fiserv, a global leader in Fintech and payments, and we move money and information in a way that moves the world. We connect financial institutions, corporations, merchants, and consumers to one another millions of times a day – quickly, reliably, and securely. Any time you swipe your credit card, pay through a mobile app, or withdraw money from the bank, we’re involved. If you want to make an impact on a global scale, come make a difference at Fiserv.

Job Title

Payment Management Specialist

What does a successful Payment Management Specialist do at Fiserv?

A Payment Management Specialist designs and maintains the business rules that facilitate processing of bill payments.


What you will do:

As a Payment Management Specialist, you will work independently and be responsible for managing and completing variety of work assignments in support of clients and payment processing.

Implement new clients for electronic bill payments as well as perform maintenance of existing payment processing rules.
Research and analyze existing business rules and consumer payment behavior to optimize electronic payment remittance and payment accuracy.
Work externally with clients and collaborate internally with different business partners in completion of projects.

What you will need to have:

As a Payment Management Specialist, you must be self-motivated, well-organized, analytically minded problem solver able to thrive in a fast paced at times stressful environment.
Must possess strong written and verbal communication skills with ability to manage multiple work assignments with competing priorities. Be respectful, open minded, flexible, open to coaching and eager to learn.
Must have a strong understanding of Microsoft Office Suite especially Excel and an ability to analyze data sets.
High School Diploma required.
Strong written and Verbal Communication Skills
Minimum 1 Year Customer/Client Service Experience

What would be great to have:

Knowledge of SQL, SSRS, SSAS, ODS, EDW, and/or other data collection presentment applications. Banking and/or bill payment experience.

This role is not eligible to be performed in Colorado, California, New York or Washington.

Please note that salary ranges provided for this role on external job boards are salary estimates made by outside parties and may not be accurate.

Warning about fake job posts:

Please be aware of fraudulent job postings that are not affiliated with Fiserv. Fraudulent job postings may be used by cyber criminals to target your personally identifiable information and/or to steal money or financial information.

We will not hire through text message, social media, or email alone, and any interviews will be conducted in person or through a secure video call. We won’t ask you for sensitive information nor will we ask you to pay anything during the hiring process. We also won’t send you a check to cash on Fiserv’s behalf.

If you see suspicious activity or believe that you have been the victim of a job posting scam, you should report it to your local FBI field office or to the FBI’s Internet Crime Complaint Center.

Job Title: Regulatory Compliance Analyst - Investigations & Data Analysis
Job Description:
Move forward with us! At NJ TRANSIT, you'll join us in transforming the third-largest transportation agency in North America. We are committed to delivering safe, reliable service that gets customers to their destinations on time-and we're looking to hire talented folks with a love of learning to make it all possible.
Summary
Responsible for conducting investigations into Conscientious Employee Protection Act (CEPA), Ethics, and Equal Pay Act (EPA) complaints/matters filed with the Compliance Department. Also responsible for creating, maintaining and updating internal compliance databases, reports, department audits and program/policy assessments. Support regulatory research, corporate policymaking and training, and programmatic innovations.
Roles and Responsibilities:
At the direction of the Senior Director, Deputy Chief Compliance Officer, and Chief Compliance Officer, assists investigations relating to CEPA, Ethics, EPA, and/or other laws or policies. Compiles information from various sources and presents the information in an organized and efficient manner to advance internal investigations.
Creates, tracks and maintains internal databases and reports regarding departmental and company-wide compliance initiatives, and produces reports analyzing compliance data.
Supports update of internal compliance-related reports, department audits and program/policy assessments.
Maintains records and record management systems for all compliance-related complaints, ethics/CEPA forms and matters, including department records and all required forms.
Under the direction of the Deputy Chief Compliance Officer, monitors and, as necessary, coordinates compliance activities of other departments to identify trends and recommend/innovate solutions.
Research and track trends and developments in the public transportation industry to enable NJ TRANSIT to stay abreast of any changes to industry best practices and implement changes to streamline corporate oversight and operating efficiencies.
Performs other compliance and/or ethics related activities as directed by the Chief Compliance Officer, Deputy Chief Compliance Officer or Senior Director, Compliance & Ethics.
Draft memoranda with proposed recommendations on matters relating to corporate compliance and oversight, e.g., Open Public Records Act, Open Public Meetings Act, statutory and regulatory issues, interpretation of corporate Bylaws, etc.
Education, Experience, and Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree and two (2) years of compliance, legal, corporate governance, investigative or regulatory experience.
Master’s degree/post-graduate degree is desired.
Excellent communication, analytical, and organizational skill is required.
Strong technical database and record management skill required, including creating and populating spreadsheets and reports.
Experience writing reports documenting investigative actions or drafting memorandums providing analysis or advice is preferred.
Demonstrated ability to find solutions to compliance-related issues and prior investigatory experience is preferred.
﻿At NJ Transit you will enjoy a competitive salary and excellent benefit package:
Comprehensive Family Health Insurance – Medical, Prescription, Dental, Vision
Flexible Spending Account
Life Insurance
Paid Leave
401(a), 401(b), 401(k) Retirement Plans - up to 9% employer contribution
Tuition Assistance

At WTW, we trust you to know your work and the people, tools and environment you need to be successful. The majority of our colleagues work in a ”hybrid” style, with a mix of remote, in-person and in-office interactions dependent on the needs of the team, role and clients. Our flexibility is rooted in trust and “hybrid” is not a one-size-fits-all solution.

We understand flexibility is key to supporting an inclusive and diverse workforce and so we encourage requests for all types of flexible working as well as location-based arrangements. Please speak to your recruiter to discuss more.

Who We Are

For over 30 years, Creative MediaWorks (CMW) has delivered custom web development, graphic design and print solutions to the exacting standards of life science companies and their agencies. We do so with a focus on quality, deadline, and accuracy. We achieve our quality standards through defined workflow processes, direct access to on-staff project talent and, quality assurance expertise, backed by an uncompromising commitment to offer the most responsive customer service in the business.

Who We’re Looking For
CMW is seeking a Business Analyst – Software Implementation Manager for our NJ office that will collaborate with our clients and our development team to implement our software solution—Speakcore. (www.speakcore.com).
Overall Responsibility
Become a subject matter expert of the Speakcore platform. Communicate between clients, stakeholders, and developers to ensure that everyone is informed and geared towards achieving the same agreed-upon goal. Collaborate with all players to establish requirements and turn them into actionable specifications for the development team, ensuring a full understanding from the team.
Specific Responsibilities:
Requirement Gathering: Manage the discovery process for each new bureau. Understand client’s business and how Speakcore can support their initiatives and goals. Gather, analyze and document business requirements from clients. Communicate and guide the client on how to use the software solution to meet their needs. Work with client to complete the requirements specification documentation in an accurate, clear, and understandable manner.
Preparing Specification Documents: Input clearly articulated tickets into the project management tool for programmers to execute. Facilitate communication and share knowledge to ensure clients’ needs are met effectively.
Project Execution: During development, provide clarity to developers, negotiate with stakeholders on conflicting requirements, etc. This may include holding meetings to deliberate on solving specific problems, identify risks and manage technology-related restrictions. Hold team status meetings to provide visibility to the project's progress, deadline, goals, objectives, and issues
Research & Requirements: Assist with guiding future development based on industry trends and customer input/feedback on the user experience and functionality of the platform
Conducting User Acceptance Tests: Perform high-level final acceptance tests to ensure agreed-upon deliverable is met. Collaborate with team and clients for User Acceptance Testing. Ensure that end-to-end cycle testing is completed for each initiative and coordinate release schedule with the DevOps team, keeping the client updated along the way.
Technical Documentation: Write documentation for our customers, which will include technical documentation, tutorials, and other implementation guides.

Who We're Looking For:

EmpiRx Health is in unprecedented growth, and we're seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Business Intelligence Analyst. In this critical role, you will interpret and present data related to market trends, customer behavior, financial analysis, or operational efficiency in a clear and meaningful way. You understand that data drives today’s decisions and when it comes to healthcare and pharmacy claims. You relish change and thrive in an environment of dynamic resilience. SQL is your tool of choice when it comes to pulling data sets and you are able to paint a great visual picture of the insights that this data brings through your expertise in Domo, Power BI, Tableau etc.

If you are a highly motivated Senior Business Intelligence Analyst with a strong background in analyzing complex data, identifying trends, and providing insights that can help in decision-making processes, and you are passionate about making a meaningful impact in the healthcare industry, we encourage you to apply.

What You'll Do:

As a Senior Business Intelligence Analyst, your role will encompass a wide range of responsibilities:

Develop and manage strong relationships, collaborating with internal customers in a consultative manner, including proactively offer them insights and suggestions.
Create accurate, timely and actionable reports, dashboards and analytics using BI tools and communicate them to the business
Working with end users, conduct data analysis, identify data trends, patterns, and insights (e.g., customer performance risks, savings opportunities, look-ahead trends and market dynamics that affect client performance, to inform business decisions.
Work with business teams to tailor the right narratives around client stories that can be derived from the data.
Liaise with business leaders to explain the possibilities and limitations of data analysis and support end users on functionality and navigation of reports and information
Assist in researching solutions and recommending actions to achieve higher levels of efficiency for the business drivers such as clinical interventions strategies, clinical savings, financial pricing models, client performance metrics and risk metrics.
Design and implement data quality controls to ensure data accuracy.
Research new analytical trends in industry (e.g. Machine Learning, AI-assisted data analysis) and apply innovative solutions to the current workflow.

What You Need:

5+ years of analyst experience in a dynamic environment
2+ years of experience in business intelligence
2+ years of experience in presenting data to internal and external stakeholders
2+ years of experience on handling large data sets for Ad-Hoc Analysis and accurately merging multiple data sources
2+ years of experience working in a healthcare environment
Advanced proficiency in BI tools such as Domo, Looker, Power BI OR Tableau
Advanced SQL and Excel skills
Independent working ability with strong time management skills
Outstanding presentation and written communication skills with the ability to communicate complex ideas through storytelling
Experience with a wide variety of analytical or statistical methods
Experience working with healthcare claims data and/or pharmacy data

Preferred Background:

Certificate in business analytics, data mining, or data science
Prior experience with, R, Python languages.
An understanding of data frames with Databricks and Spark SQL based technologies

About Us:
Kaleidoscope ABA provides center-based, community, and home-based Applied Behavioral Analysis (ABA) Therapy services to children and young adults. We use evidence-based, best-practice models to support and provide effective treatment to individuals with Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) as well as other behavioral and developmental disabilities. Our team partners with family members to create individualized ABA treatment plans designed to meet the individual needs of each person we serve.

Kaleidoscope Family Solutions ABA, Inc. is an EEO employer.



About Kaleidoscope ABA:



Kaleidoscope Family Solutions (KFS) is privately owned and has been providing services to individuals with disabilities since 2004. Since our inception, KFS has focused on in-home and in-community services that promote the healthy development of children, adults, and families through one-on-one behavioral, educational, and daily-living supports. KFS helps individuals become independent, integrated and productive members of their community and allows them to lead everyday lives. KFS has grown to become a multi-state provider with over 15 years of experience in the field of disabilities. We have become a leader in this field by focusing on one key principle that distinguishes our services: Person-Centered Treatment. Starting in 2019 Kaleidoscope ABA Services began providing ABA Therapy treatment in-homes as well as in our centers. The evidence-based history of Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) therapy has proven it to be a best practice model used to support and provide effective treatment to individuals with Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) as well as other behavioral and developmental disabilities. Treatment is provided individually and in small settings to create the most impact and learning opportunities for children. Helping your child develop independence and grow into adulthood is our whole life. We strive to provide both individual and community support to your family through advocacy, offering free parent support groups and by connecting you with resources beyond our own organization. You will find strength through our local and national network of individuals and families that are part of the Kaleidoscope family and embody the Kaleidoscope ABA Way.

Facilitate JAD Sessions, and analyze business problems. Skills required: Java, Visual Studio, Clear Quest, VISIO, PL/SQL, HTML, Rational Rose, Unix and VB.NET. Master’s degree in Science, Technology, Engineering, Business Administration or any related field with 1 year of experience in job offered or related occupation is required. Bachelor’s degree in the above-mentioned fields along with 5 years of experience in job offered or related occupation is acceptable in lieu of Master’s degree plus 1 year of experience. Any suitable combination of education, training or experience is acceptable. Work location: Piscataway, NJ and various unanticipated locations throughout the U.S.


Send Resume to HR Dept., EXA Data Solutions, Inc., 15 Corporate Place South, Suite 320, Piscataway, NJ 08854.




Submit your applications online and our internal team will be in touch with the suitable candidates to discuss more on the relevant career opportunity.

Should the candidate accept employment with EXA Data Solutions, Inc., the referring employee will be eligible to receive an award of $1,000.00 for the successful referral.

Overview:
The primary purpose of the Quality Data Analyst is to provide quantitative measurement and data analysis expertise under the direction of the Manager Data Analytics. Responsible for implementing established, as well as developing and applying innovative techniques for measuring, analyzing, and reporting on healthcare processes, patient outcomes, and clinical cost effectiveness. Carries out data management responsibilities for clinical data that are needed to fulfill the organizational quality improvement plan and to meet regulatory requirements.

Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree in Public Health, a health-related profession, Business Administration or a related field required. Six (6) years of progressively more responsible experience which includes analytical and/or statistical responsibilities, with three (3) years in a healthcare environment. Experience in performing exploratory data analysis and database management a must. Expertise in MS Office required, and experience with statistical software applications preferred. Must possess strong verbal and written communication skills and the ability to work independently and as a member of a team. Additional related experience may be substituted for the degree on a year-for-year basis.

To gather, interpret, analyze, and translate the business user concepts/ideas into comprehensive business requirements by conducting elicitation and Joint Application Design (JAD) sessions. Author business requirement/specification document, functional requirement/specification document to transcribe design documents, operational processes, functional specifications, use cases, business rules, and process flow diagram. Work with developers to enable features at front end application, develop database and ETL process to load the existing data to store the data for the business process. Construct UML diagram, workflow charts and domain models; study system capabilities; writing specifications. Work with QA team to design test plan and test cases for User Acceptance Testing (UAT) and map them back to requirements for traceability reporting. To analyze the testing results and traceability reports to develop checklists and evaluate production readiness. Requires Master’s degree or foreign equivalent in Computer Science, Healthcare Administration, Business Administration, Public Administration, Management, or related. Email resume with cover letter to hr@intone.com; Job 22ITN44; EOE

Location: Piscataway, NJ and other unanticipated locations nationwide

Duties:

Produce financial and market intelligence by querying data repositories and generating periodic reports.
Utilize Agile methodology, Access, Excel, Oracle, MS Visio, Signavio, JIRA, SharePoint, ETL, SQL Server Management Studio, and Teradata.

Requirements:

Master’s degree or equivalent in Science, Engineering or related field with at least six (6) months of experience in the field.
Any suitable combination of education, training, or experience is acceptable. Travel/relocation may be required.

How to Apply:

Send copy of resume w/ proof of work eligibility to: Pozent Corporation, 371 Hoes Lane, Suite 200, Piscataway, NJ 08854.

Job Description:
Job Title:Sr Business Analyst
Introduction:
At GAF, we cover more than buildings. We cover each other. No matter what role, tenure, or track, under this roof you are empowered to be there for your teammates, your customers, and especially your community. Under this roof, we don’t back down from hard work– we support one another in pursuit of something bigger. We define the future while leading the present. And under this roof, we own our opportunities. Becoming the market leader only happens when everyone feels they have the opportunity, and the support, to thrive. We are GAF. And under this roof, we protect what matters most.

Summary: We are seeking a Senior Business Analyst with an expertise in enterprise web site development to support multiple dot com sites. The Senior Business Analyst will have responsibility for performing detailed analysis and documenting business requirements and system impact to ensure the successful delivery of website initiatives.
The Senior Business Analyst must have knowledge of the capabilities of website development.

Essential Duties:
70% Work with constituents across the organization to understand current processes, systems and opportunities and capture requirements for new processes, systems, user interfaces and user experiences through various methods, including to but not limited to requirements gathering sessions, interviews, surveys, workshops, etc.

Collaborate with vendor partners and internal team members to communicate needs and requirements and determine appropriate solutions.

Advise on best practices.

Document current and future state in various forms including functional requirements, user stories, wireframes, interface designs, workflows, swim-lane diagrams, presentations, etc. for appropriate audiences including C-Level, business stakeholders and technical teams.

20% Collaborating with IT Development (onshore/offshore) and QA to ensure appropriate and adequate system testing is performed.
Facilitating User Acceptance Testing (UAT).
5% Providing guidance, reviewing work and providing feedback to other team members.
5% Performing other duties as assigned.

Under This Roof, We Require
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business (with IT focus), or related majors and/or track record of work experience in areas described above.
5+ years’ experience in systems analysis and design with a proven record of successful medium to large scale project implementations, preferably in enterprise Business-to-Business durableable goods, construction, or building materials. manufacturing.
Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP) or similar certification is a plus.

Under This Roof, We Also Value
Strong experience and demonstrated ability to document web-based systems, and perform analysis and design using various methods, including: business requirements, functional specifications, user stories/acceptance criteria, use cases, swim lanes, and process flows, swim lane diagrams, AS-IS / TO-BE diagrams, and mock-ups/wireframes.
The ability to bridge the gap between the user experience and technology.
Experience with visually modeling requirements using tools such as Invision.
Experience in SDLC and Agile/Scrum methodology.
Experience with documenting requirements for integrations between enterprise systems.
Strong experience in business process design and workflow analysis.
The ability to relate product data to ancillary web-based systems.
Strong knowledge and execution of IT Standards, Policies and Procedures.
Knowledge of Information Security Awareness.
Knowledge of Project Management Methodology & Tools.
Experience in working with multiple data sources, and ERPs is a plus.
Experience with Sitecore is a plus.
Experience in the Manufacturing Industry is a plus.
Experience in building Marketing, Sales and Ecommerce sites is a plus.
Experience in Jira is a plus.
Google Suite and Lucid Charts knowledge is a plus
How We Protect What Matters Most
We offer a wide range of health insurance options that include medical, dental, and vision for you and your family.
Our Family-Building benefits support the many different journeys to fertility and parenthood.
Our robust 401K plan includes an employer match contribution with your pre-tax and/or Roth contributions.
Other exciting programs and perks are available to help employees achieve work-life balance, including (but not limited to) a wellness program, free financial coaching, a referral program, and product rebates when purchased for an employee’s primary residence.
Professional growth and development are very important to us! We offer internal training programs and courses, as well as a generous tuition reimbursement program.
We put diversity and inclusion into action with our Employee Resource Groups, which unite employees based on common perspectives, identities, demographic factors, or out of a desire to be an ally.
GAF complies with federal, state, and local disability laws and makes reasonable accommodations for applicants and employees with disabilities. If a reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and/or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please contact HR Services at 833-HR-XPERT.
We believe our employees are our greatest resource. We offer competitive salary, benefits, 401k, and vacation packages for all full time permanent positions. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and GAF, Standard Logistics, SGI, and Siplast are proud to be affirmative action employers. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know. If applying for positions in the U.S., must be eligible to work in the U.S. without need for employer sponsored visa (work permit).

We are seeking a skilled Warehouse Operations Analyst to join our MGX Beverage warehouse team. The primary focus of this role is to generate and analyze key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure operational effectiveness. The Operations Analyst will play a vital role in providing meaningful insights to the business, utilizing data modeling and visualization techniques to communicate the story. This role is responsible for analyzing and evaluating various aspects of the warehouse, including inventory control, order fulfillment, labor utilization, and overall process improvement. The Operations Analyst uses data-driven insights to identify opportunities for optimization, implement solutions, and drive continuous improvement initiatives within the warehouse environment.

Essential Functions:

Generate and analyze key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure business performance: Develop and maintain a comprehensive set of KPIs to measure operational effectiveness and efficiency in the warehouse environment.
Provide meaningful insights: Collect and analyze data related to warehouse operations, including inventory levels, order volumes, picking and packing efficiency, and labor utilization. Identify patterns, trends, and areas for improvement based on data analysis, and provide regular updates and insights to business stakeholders
Process Evaluation: Evaluate existing warehouse processes and workflows to identify bottlenecks, inefficiencies, and areas of improvement. Conduct time and motion studies, analyze order processing workflows, process mapping, and root cause analysis to identify opportunities for optimization. Identify opportunities to reduce order processing time, improve order accuracy, and enhance customer satisfaction.
Warehouse management systems (WMS): Leverage expertise in warehouse management systems (WMS) to extract and analyze data, identifying trends and areas for optimization.
Reporting and Communication: Prepare regular reports, dashboards, and presentations to communicate insights and recommendations to management and stakeholders. Present findings, progress, and improvement initiatives in meetings.
Data modeling and visualization: Utilize data modeling techniques and advanced Excel skills to create models, charts, and graphs that effectively communicate complex data sets to business stakeholders.
Training and Support: Provide training and support to warehouse staff on process changes, system updates, and best practices. Ensure that employees understand and adhere to standard operating procedures (SOPs) and safety guidelines.
Data integrity maintenance: Ensure the accuracy, completeness, and consistency of data by implementing quality control measures and data validation techniques.
Cross-functional collaboration: Collaborate with various teams such as inventory control, inventory management and warehouse management to gather data, understand requirements, and develop solutions for operational challenges.
Profit-minded approach: Identify opportunities for cost reduction and operational efficiency improvements through data analysis and collaborate with relevant stakeholders to implement appropriate measures. Apply a profit-minded mindset to all analyses and decision-making, focusing on improving financial performance and contributing to overall business profitability.

Skills and Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Operations Management, Business Analytics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or a related field; applicable experience in lieu of degree.
Proven experience as an Operations Analyst or in a similar analytical role.
Prior experience in a warehouse or distribution environment is preferred.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate data into actionable insights.
Proficiency in data analysis tools, techniques, and software, including advanced Excel functions and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Familiarity with warehouse management systems (WMS) and their data structures.
Strong knowledge of enterprise resource planning systems (ERPs), previous experience with MS Navision is preferred
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present complex data findings in a clear and concise manner.
Detail-oriented with a focus on data accuracy and integrity.
Strong organizational and time management skills, with the ability to work on multiple projects and priorities simultaneously.
Continuous learning mindset to stay updated with industry trends and emerging analytics techniques.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $75,000.00 - $90,000.00 per year

Benefits:

401(k)
401(k) matching
Dental insurance
Health insurance
Life insurance
Paid time off
Retirement plan
Vision insurance

Experience level:

4 years

Schedule:

Monday to Friday

Ability to commute/relocate:

Edison, NJ 08837: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)

Experience:

Data Analysis tools: 2 years (Preferred)
Warehouse management system: 2 years (Preferred)
Data modeling and Visualization: 2 years (Required)
Operations Analyst: 3 years (Required)
Warehouse Operations: 2 years (Required)

Work Location: In person

Job Title: Data Analytics & Business Intelligence Insurance Lead
Job Description:
Company Description


We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable.



Job Description


The Analytical Data Operations (ADO) division is Verisk/ISO's data refinery, ensuring that ISO's analytical engines are properly fueled. As a member of ADO you will be part of a team of data analysts, BI developers, data engineers, data architects, and actuarial/analytical-engineers that are dedicated to improve our data analytics platform to support a host of products the US P&C industry relies on.

Your purpose is to serve as subject matter expert for all data and related information for the line of business experience. You will collaborate with other team leads and stakeholders to understand and explain industry trends and develop industry expertise across our product portfolio. Additionally, you will work with our international data operations team to develop new tools to expand and enhance your team’s ability to develop industry insights at scale and to drive real change in the US P&C insurance market.

You will operate within a Shared Services model, where you will be expected to manage stakeholder expectations and organize deliverables across junior staff. You will be expected to develop expertise in multiple lines of business, AGILE project management, and advanced analytics using SQL on our cloud data warehouse, being at the forefront of data analytics for the P&C industry. Your responsibilities include:

Work directly with line of business stakeholders to understand business needs, gather, manipulate, and analyze data to deliver digestible insights that drive business decisions

Analyze industry data for personal lines property coverages to identify trends, anomalies, and data quality issues, ensuring product teams are aware of impacts to our analytics driven by industry experience

Develop data reports and visualizations using business intelligence and analytics software

Lead quarterly presentations with LOB stakeholders to discuss data analysis results, summarizing and synthesizing analysis from junior team members, and documenting key take aways from discussions

Mange our data steward relationship with the insurance carriers, providing prompt and meaningful analysis of their data to ensure their compliance with regulatory requirements and the applicability of our industry benchmark analytics to their business

Drive organizational change in how we deliver results both internally and externally



Qualifications


Required Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in a STEM major or with STEM coursework learned in associated majors (Actuarial Science, Computer Science, Data Engineering, Data Science, Mathematics, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Finance, Economics)

A minimum of three years P&C insurance data analysis experience with a focus on Commercial Property Lines or Casualty coverages such as General Liability, Medical Professional Liability, and Personal Liability would be beneficial

Excellent communication skills (both oral and written) are required, with a desire to improve presentation and persuasion skills

A passion for using data and technology to understand the real world and drive change with a focus on the importance of data quality

Experience supervising junior team members and a strong record of building great stakeholder relationships

Excellent SQL, Excel/BI skills with a focus on data analysis

A self-starter with a commitment to innovation and pro-active problem solving

Preferred Qualifications

Experience in Python, VBA, SAS, and R is preferred.

Commitment to attainment of an insurance professional designation (ACAS, CPCU, AIDM)

Commitment to attainment of a technology or project management designations

You will be part of a culture that celebrates success, recognizes and rewards achievements and excellence, and provides personal and professional enrichment opportunities.

#LI-MC1

In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. For over fifty years and through innovation, interpretation, and professional insight, Verisk has replaced uncertainty with precision to unlock opportunities that deliver significant and demonstrable impact. From our historic roots in risk assessment, we’ve grown to provide analytic insights that help transform industries focused on some of the world’s most critical areas. Today, the insurance industry relies on Verisk to be, and to make the world, more productive, resilient, and sustainable.

Verisk works in collaboration with our customers and at the intersection of people, data, and advanced technologies. Through proprietary platformed analytics, advanced modeling, and interpretation, we deliver immediate and sustained value to our customers and through them, to the individuals and societies they serve, with greater speed, precision, and scale.

We’re 9,000 people strong, committed to translating big data into big ideas. We help others see new possibilities and empower certainty into big decisions that impact individuals and societies. And we relentlessly and ethically pursue innovation to help move our customers, and the world, toward better tomorrows.

Everyone at Verisk—from our chief executive officer to our newest employee—is guided by The Verisk Way, to Be Remarkable, Add Value, and Innovate.

Be Remarkable by doing something better each day in service to our customers and each other

Innovate by redefining what’s possible, embracing challenges, and pushing boundaries

Underwriting Solutions — provides underwriting and rating solutions for auto and property, general liability, and excess and surplus to assess and price risk with speed and precision

Verisk Maplecroft — provides intelligence on sustainability, resilience, and ESG, helping people, business, and societies become stronger

Job Description
*** To be considered for the position, please submit a cover letter, resume and a list of three references.***
Essential Duties & Responsibilities:
Database Queries & Reports; Prepare and provide data for periodic reports;
Coordinate and implement SEVIS reporting procedures for data collection and Batch processes; identify Batch glitches; assists in training staff members on Batching;
Perform complex data reconciliation and analysis to ensure institutional compliance; responsible for preparing and compiling statistical reports through Terra Dotta, SEVIS, and Stevens systems (Workday); develop graphic representations of data for presentations and reports
Manage continual updates and maintenance of standard Terra Dotta email texts.
Manage, monitor and update data reported to SEVIS;
Manage F-1 & J-1 alerts for international students & scholars in SEVIS and Terra Dotta;
Provide periodic technical status and reports to the Director
Provide information and recommendations to ISSS staff.
Coordinate with the Information Technology department to make upgrades to systems as needed;
Attend conferences and give conference presentations when needed on Database Maintenance & Management
Manage new and continuing student registration in SEVIS, via batch. Manage communication and address updates to SEVIS, via batch.
Manage SEVIS-related database maintenance and data clean-up services as needed (duplicate records, data inconsistencies, archiving, etc.).
Manage, monitor and ensure record retention per the University record retention policy and federal regulations.
Manage Student Information System (Workday) to Terra Dotta data feed.
Manage, monitor and update Stevens’ student information system (Workday), including reports, queries and data
Perform system audits to ensure the integrity and consistency of data in Terra Dotta, and campus databases, with SEVIS data, and manage correction of any inconsistent data.
Respond to and resolve technical or institutional access problems related to electronic business processes, or request and coordinate outside help when needed.
Manage all student/scholar-related IT ticket submissions and Terra Dotta portal/eForm issues for F-1 and J-1 students.
Manage, monitor and update Stevens ISSS website/internal web pages/systems; Manage client and departmental inquiries related to access to Terra Dotta portal/eForm submission, Terra Dotta/SEVIS portal pin resets, merging records and eForm resets. Provide back up support for the University database maintenance and data clean-up services as needed (duplicate records, data inconsistencies, archiving, etc.).
Submit tickets to IT and/or contact Terra Dotta in the event of unexpected system issues.
Database & Electronic Business Services Production & Development Identify and research areas for technical improvements to ISSS processes, and suggest potential changes or enhancements.
Monitor effectiveness of new processes, propose and implement changes as appropriate, and expand as needed to serve new purposes.
Provide recommendations for continuous improvements in data collection and maintenance, and for improvement of data integrity. Participate in activities and groups related to database and system improvements.
Provide consultation on web-based database application development projects for Terra Dotta.
Train ISSS staff in use of advisor-related SEVIS/Workday/Slate, Terra Dotta and website functions. Campus-wide Terra Dotta training and on-going productions support including documentation to be used for training and on-going reference.
Maintain campus-wide electronic business process documentation and update as needed due to updates in SEVIS and other database systems, as well as changes in internal ISSS processes and procedures.
Monitor all SEVIS and Terra Dotta alerts for F-1/J-1 students remain current with SEVIS-related and regulatory updates pertaining to international students and scholars to ensure institutional compliance.
Create Terra Dotta tracking mechanism and monitor international student and scholar compliance with Stevens and federal health insurance requirements.
Monitor daily Terra Dotta workflow for errors and resolve or route to appropriate person for resolution. Advise international students and scholars to the extent necessary to make recommendations for revision of existing, or creation of new, ISSS electronic business processes.
Act as a primary resource/liaison to other departments regarding the data/records and status of international students and scholars;
Perform duties of a Designated School Official (DSO) and Alternate Responsible Officer (ARO);
Work with the Associate Director for Incoming International Student to process I-20s during peak season; issue DS-2019s for newly accepted and visiting students;
Provide counseling and advising support to international students on immigration related matters, including changes of status, leave of absence, and transitional and other support issues; as a member of the on-call team of advisors hold regular open office hours;
Serve as a resource on immigration regulations, policies and practices to faculty and staff;
Oversee F-1 immigration check-in and the SEVIS registration process;
Assist in the development, implementation, and presentation of specialized workshops and programs;
Assists in designing and updating office handouts, forms, presentations, and websites;
Assists in ensuring University compliance with federal immigration laws and SEVIS regulations;
Performs other job related duties as assigned.
Minimum Requirements:
A Bachelor's degree in a relevant field.
Three (3) years of relevant work experience in a higher education environment, with international student and exchange scholar populations and regulations, including understanding of SEVIS, F, and J Visa requirements or/and 3 years of specific experience with database/statistical software, tools and information retrieval methods, such as SAS Enterprise Guide, SAS Visual Analytics, Qualtrics, Google Looker Studio, Slate, Formstack, Stata, Workday, Tableau, Denodo, and SQL Developer.
Demonstrated experience with SQL and managing relational databases.
Advanced proficiency with Excel, Google Sheets and Microsoft apps
Proficiency in various programing and reporting languages including HTML, Java, and Liquid Markup
Experience using data visualization to effectively and efficiently convey complex statistical/analytical concepts to lay audiences including administrators, faculty, and other decision-makers and stakeholders.
Excellent planning analytical, problem solving, customer satisfaction, communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to make administrative/procedural decisions, direct complex projects, meet deadlines, track accomplishments and meet established goals and objectives
Skill in using data systems
US Citizenship or Permanent Resident required to access SEVIS due to the government designation required.

Minimum Qualifications:



Bachelor's degree required; degree in business/marketing analytics, information systems, statistics, or marketing preferred.
2-4 years' experience in marketing data interpretation and reporting; healthcare industry experience preferred.
Must possess strong ability to perform analysis and communicate findings in actionable manner.
Experience with analytics reporting and data interpretation/presentation
SQL report writing skills required.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Applications Skills required.

Strong ability to work independently and within team setting to achieve outcomes



POSITION SUMMARY

The Marketing Business Analyst is responsible for performing research and providing insights regarding the market, trends, competitors, potential and existing customers, and current campaigns. This role is responsible for overseeing, organizing, and optimizing marketing data used to help drive strategic decisions and work activities for the AtlantiCare Marketing & Communications department.

This position will be responsible for the collection, validation, and analysis of marketing and business data from multiple access points and interprets the output as charts, graphs, tables, dashboards and correlations using available software such as Excel and Tableau.

The analyst delivers comparative and correlative analyses to support business decision and quality improvement initiatives created and implemented by the AtlantiCare Marketing & Communications department. The Marketing Business Analyst collaborates with members of the Marketing Services team, Digital team, and Marketing leadership.

QUALIFICATIONS

EDUCATION: Bachelor's degree required; degree in business/marketing analytics, information systems, statistics, or marketing preferred.

LICENSE/CERTIFICATION:

EXPERIENCE: Minimum 4 years of previous data analyst experience required. Advanced MS Excel and Access skills/experience required. Proficiency in Microsoft Office Applications Skills required. Strong oral, written communication and problem solving skills required.

PERFORMANCE EXPECTATIONS

Demonstrates the competencies as established on the Assessment and Evaluation Tool for this position.

WORK ENVIRONMENT

Potential for exposure to the hazards and risk of the hospital environment, including exposure to infectious disease, hazardous substances, and potential injury. This position requires some walking/standing and may have prolonged periods of sitting. Works with such equipment as computer terminal, fax machine, printer, telephone and copier. Position requires some travel, flexibility of hours including weekends, evenings and on-call duties as well as lifting up to 20 lbs. Essential functions for this position are listed on the Assessment and Evaluation Tool.

REPORTING RELATIONSHIP

This position reports to AVP, Marketing & Communications.

The above statement reflect the general details considered necessary to describe the principle functions of the job as identified and shall not be considered as a detailed description of all work requirements that may be inherent in the position.

Job Title: Associate - Data Analysis and Special Projects
Job Description:
Location Designation: Hybrid


When you join New York Life, you’re joining a company that values career development, collaboration, innovation, and inclusiveness. We want employees to feel proud about being part of a company that is committed to doing the right thing. You’ll have the opportunity to grow your career while developing personally and professionally through various resources and programs. New York Life is a relationship-based company and appreciates how both virtual and in-person interactions support our culture.


This position involves a hybrid work schedule - working remotely: Monday & Friday / on site: Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday.


The Pension Risk Transfer (PRT) Installation Team is looking for an Associate to on-board new PRT business. The primary responsibilities of the Associate will consist of setting up payments for participants, tracking data and producing certificates, as well as supporting our Service team. The Associate should have a good understanding of excel and strong communication skills. Knowledge of Pension Plans is a plus.


Primary Responsibilities:




Supporting the installation, set up and maintenance of databases containing information for participants purchased under single premium group annuity contracts
Calculate nonstandard items, which include lump sum illustrations, benefit split calculations for Qualified Domestic Relations Orders, and premium due or refund for participant census changes
Convert participant-level census data into a consistent format for use in pricing models
Act as a resource for the interpretation of group annuity contract provisions and related benefit quotations
Key partner in providing technical, analytical, and testing support for area projects to improve processing efficiency
Provide support and assistance to area personnel responding to inquiries from participants, financial institutions, and clients to ensure a high level of service excellence
Provide responses to technical questions related to the claims and death processing and other functions for the PRT block of business
Understand and stay current with operational procedures


Qualifications:




Bachelor’s Degree required; math aptitude
2-3+ years of related exp.
Strong oral and written communication skills. Must be able to effectively communicate with various internal/external clients and teams at different levels
A positive attitude and a willingness to work as a member of a close-knit team
Knowledge of, or a desire to learn, the provisions of group annuity contracts and ability to interpret them and perform related mathematical calculations
Accountable, ethical, good decision-making ability
Advanced Excel skills
Experience with defined benefit pension plans a plus


Additional Requirements:




Ability to take the lead on specific projects
Ability to work independently while remaining flexible to meet team goals


This position is eligible for a discretionary bonus and benefits.

Job Title

Business Intelligence Analyst

What does a successful Business Intelligence Analyst do at Fiserv?

The Cyber Risk Business Intelligence Analyst will be responsible for performing data analysis, report development, building visualizations, and improving the information portal delivery. The role will be supporting the cybersecurity organization and technology/business partners across the firm. The person will be responsible for design and development of the web portal content to guide business activity. The ideal candidate will have the curiosity and skills to investigate the data from multiple angles, conduct research and identifying trends while partnering with colleagues to match data from multiple resources to make recommendations. The candidate will have experience in building solutions based on KPIs and metrics.

What you will do:

Design, build and deploy business intelligence solutions for the organization.
Maintain and support data analytics platforms.
Conduct unit testing and troubleshooting.
Collaborate with teams across the organization to manage information portal content and drive requirements for continual improvements and enhancements.
Communicate internally to collect and validate data as well as answer questions regarding reports and data.
Translate business needs to technical specifications.
Build automation and additional efficiencies into manual reporting efforts.
Helps implement new practices, processes, and procedures.
Create and maintain relevant documentation.

What you will need to have:

Bachelor’s degree in Data Analytics, MIS, Computer Science or equivalent and 7+ years relevant work experience
7+ years’ experience on multiple (3+) BI related projects i.e. reporting, visualization, web portal
5+ years’ experience with enterprise Power BI
2+ years’ experience with additional BI tools (Looker/Grafana/Tableau)
Experience developing and maintaining BI solutions for the organization.
Experience developing and maintaining dashboards, preparing data visualizations, and correlating data to improve decision making ability.
Experience with SharePoint online and Office 365/Power Platform tools and services (Power BI/Power Automate/Flow/Forms)
Advanced level knowledge of SQL queries, performance optimization and data warehousing design principles.
In-depth understanding of database management systems, online analytical processing, and ELT frameworks.
Gather, analyze, and translate business needs into actionable, clearly defined user stories.
Leverages Jira to track requirements, prioritize features, curate content, sequence deliverables into sprints, and report progress.

What would be great to have:

Cybersecurity KPIs and Metrics
Security Event and Information Management experience
Google Cloud Platform (Big Query/Looker)

Job Title

Senior Business Analyst

What does a successful Business Analyst do?

They will drive requirements gathering sessions in project meetings with the client and work with cross-functional client stakeholders to complete application requirements and scoping. This is a key role focused on championing and establishing product requirements and ensuring that the organization is prepared for new products and product launches. As a Business Analyst on this team, you will interact with Team Leadership as well as multiple Subject Matter Experts and technical teams to draw out business requirements, create and functional and design documents, and prepare all necessary User Interface designs (wireframes).

What will you do?

Formulate and define Business Requirements & Use Cases.
Create collateral such as reference docs, user guides, etc. in support of the products and solutions.
Document functional requirements and determine complexity of work for applicable projects.
Work with Solutions Consultants and Solutions Architects to create proposal documents and requirements templates.
Provide analysis to resolve production issues Support and/or perform User Acceptance Test (UAT).
Participate in product demos and requirements process.
Participate in Agile development activities such as stand-up meetings, sprint planning, sprint retrospective, continuous improvement, and cross-functional collaboration; serve as Scrum Master.
Gather and document requirements and high-level estimates for defect fixes and enhancements.
Work closely with Technical, QA and Business Teams in explaining the requirements and provide functional guidance/answers.
Preliminary functional testing Prepare Help/Support Documentation for new features/fixes.
Use JIRA to manage Sprints – create Stories, coordinate with the Scrum Team to assign/update tasks Participate & Contribute in functional framework discussions.

What will you need to have:

Bachelor’s degree in computer science/information systems or equivalent professional work experience.
Experience conducting preliminary analysis and estimations for new product feature requests.
Experience in writing requirement documents for application development.

What would be great to have:

3-5 years Financial Institution experience.
Power BI or other analytic tools and dashboard exp.
3 to 5 years of business experience within the Banking and/or Credit Union industries...specifically in the areas of Deposit Products, Deposit Transaction Processing, and Lending.
Familiarity with working in Agile.
Knowledge of the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) Process including agile methodologies.
Ability to write high quality requirements that are easily consumable by the application team.
Familiarity in writing test plans and software testing.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills as this position requires extensive communication between technical and non-technical audiences.
Must be self-directed and highly motivated with the ability to work independently as well as with a team.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple priorities simultaneously.
Ability to develop and maintain positive working relationships.
