Description

You will be the technical and operational interface and “go-to guru” between IT and Operations as it relates to the initial deployment, training, configuration and support of our WMS application. In this newly created role, you will have the opportunity to implement a new warehouse application system - ensuring that all warehouse systems are operating smoothly, and that our customers are getting an exceptional service experience. The WMS Operations Analyst will be responsible for the data flows, issue resolution and configuration throughout the implementation process. Define, document, and consult on functional and technical requirements to support daily operations. Serving as the first point of contact for the user community, supporting issue validation and scoping, acting as the liaison between users and the IT team.

Key Responsibilities


Provide implementation support / coordination of WMS to include initial warehouse and customer configuration, user training within the facility for Go live preparation and application testing with IT, customer and local users.
Provide post implementation support (1st level) for local site operational issues and (re) configuration requirements for continuous improvement projects.
Support new release testing against customer requirements.
Identify and recommend change controls to support operational enhancements and fixes.
Develop and maintain process documentation, including standard operating procedures, work instructions, and training materials.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement new programs and process improvements.
Analyze data and present findings to management for decision-making.
Provide training and support to warehouse personnel to ensure successful implementation of new processes.
Execute data extracts and analysis to build business cases to support system changes.

Skills, Knowledge and Expertise

Bachelor’s degree in Industrial Engineering, Computer Science Information Systems, Logistics or related field.
3-5 years of experience in a 3PL environment.
Strong knowledge of WMS systems, experience with WMS implementation and optimization.
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
Willingness to work flexible hours and travel as needed.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to work independently and in a team environment.
Experience in project management or lead role in technical implementations preferred.
Strong knowledge of SQL Server, Oracle, and other Database Technologies
Experience in documenting process flows and operational procedures.

About ColdTrack
Pick. Pack. Ship. Grow…Profitably. All while keeping it cold.

At ColdTrack, we believe that shipping perishable products doesn’t have to be complicated or costly. We partner with you to ensure your cold and frozen products are delivered to your customers – with significant improvement to your bottom line.

In fact, we know that batching and shipping alone won’t solve your problem. We provide a personalized and comprehensive approach that ensures you get your products into the hands of your customers – faster, easier, and more cost effectively than ever before – all while staying cold.

Job Title: Senior Analyst, Supply Chain Customer Solutions
Job Description:
Johnson & Johnson Health Care Systems Inc. (HCS) is currently recruiting for a Senior Analyst, Supply Chain Customer Solutions, to support our Medical Device partnerships across regional strategic hospital systems. Remote work options may be considered on a case-by-case basis and if approved by the Company.



Johnson & Johnson Health Care Systems Inc. provides account management and customer support services to key health care customers, including hospital systems and group purchasing organizations, leading health plans, pharmacy benefit managers, and government health care institutions. The company also provides contract management, logistics and supply chain functions for the major Johnson & Johnson franchises.



Johnson & Johnson Deliver Group is part of Johnson & Johnson’s global Supply Chain organization supporting operations across all of the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies. Deliver strives to achieve an exceptional customer experience through leading critical customer-facing-functions such as customer service, distribution and transportation. In addition, Deliver oversees critical business enablers, including how we gather and manage supply chain master data, safe and secure supply chain practices, product identification standards, and market/channel access capabilities. It supports both sectors of Johnson & Johnson: MedTech (including Vision), Pharmaceutical. Deliver is a critical component of our supply chain, working collaboratively to ensure that quality, safety and the experience of our customers is our top priority.



As the Senior Analyst, you will directly be supporting the MedTech segment and the hospital IDN customers. You will support the regional team(s) in the development, deployment and delivery of supply chain solutions to segmented IDN customers in the assigned region(s). You will have a high degree of autonomy to assess the supply chain, recommend, and implement solutions as required by Regional Leadership and the customer. You will conduct sophisticated supply chain analysis using a variety of data sources to diagnose the cost to serve, effectiveness and efficiency of the JJMD to IDN supply chain. You will have direct customer interface in the assessment of the customer's supply chain and the delivery of supply chain customer solutions. You will apply a broad set of supply chain skills to effectively deliver solutions to include: Lean, Six Sigma, Vendor Managed Inventory (VMI), principles of inventory management, customer dashboards, project management and cost analytics.



Key Responsibilities:

Mine and analyze data across multiple data sources: Order to Cash (multiple), Transportation, Finance, Distribution, E-Commerce; as well as Customer provided data sets
Identify cost, efficiency and / or effectiveness opportunities to Hospital IDN Customer supply chain
Assess and prioritize solutions to deploy to the customer that align to customer and JJMD Joint Business Plan objectives
Interface directly with customer SC staff in the diagnosis and prioritization process and shape existing SC solutions to match customer’s needs and capabilities
Engage in Lean assessments directly with customer; may lead Lean assessments on-site with customer
Maintain expert knowledge of approximately 20-30 Supply Chain solutions and effectively deploy these solutions
Collaborate across multiple partners in the deployment of SC Customer Solutions: Customer SC staff; Commercial, Customer Credit Management, Contract Strategy & Management, Finance, IT, Customer Experience, Distribution, E-Commerce, Transportation
Independently find opportunities, conduct root cause/trending analysis, and develop/implement short- and long-term solutions using knowledge of products, processes, and other subject matter experts
Maintain customer scorecard / dashboard to track progress against specific customer initiatives; Monitor and report on customer performance and business activity monthly
Support overall Supply Chain inventory management relationship and executes the VMI process with designated customers which may include planning and analyzing daily inventory levels and forecasts at the product code level
Manage product level alignment between customer and JJHCS system – data integrity aligned with GS1 standards
Utilize tools such as ABC Analysis and Full Case Analysis in support of inventory management recommendations



QUALIFICATIONS
Minimum of Bachelor's degree required; A Bachelors with a focused degree in Supply Chain or Engineering preferred; advanced degree is also preferred
Minimum 4 years of relevant work experience required
Requires Logistics, Supply Chain or Commercial experience
Customer-facing experience preferred
Requires demonstrated understanding of the end to end supply chain
Finance knowledge and/or work experience preferred in any of the following areas: Customer Service, accounts receivable, deduction management, or cash application and collections
Strong time management skills and ability to prioritize initiatives appropriately is required
LEAN /Process Excellence knowledge is preferred
Project management experience preferred
Healthcare or Medical Device sector/industry experience is preferred
Requires proficiency in Excel, including VLOOKUPS and Pivot Tables
Working knowledge of SAP preferred
Requires up to 25% domestic travel

The anticipated base pay range for this position is $76,000 to $121,900.

The annual performance bonus is a cash bonus intended to provide an incentive to achieve annual targeted results by rewarding for individual and the corporation’s performance over a calendar/ performance year. Company Summary

Jacobson, Goldfarb & Scott, Inc. (JGS Insurance) was established over 100 years ago as an Independent Insurance Agency that is privately owned. We are a growing company with innovation, respect, and hard work as key to our culture. We are committed to a dynamic and service-oriented approach with our employees as well as our clients. Our goal is to assure that our customers are receiving the most comprehensive and competitive programs in terms of cost, coverage and service. Located in the beautiful MetroBurb of Bell Works, JGS offers a comfortable and modern work environment with restaurants, markets, events, and many other activities.





Position Summary:

JGS Insurance is looking for a Business Analyst that will help in facilitating assigned projects by serving as a liaison between users and developers, setting and communicating goals, and evaluating and refining system results. This role will collaborate with our business and development staff to create a state-of-the-art RQI (Rate Quote Issue) platform. This will be a partially remote position.





Duties/Responsibilities

Collaborates with business staff to thoroughly understand the needs to be supported by the information systems and technology.

Determines how changes to the project will affect the business and systems.

Responds to inquiries and provides advice to the business group regarding current and potential system inputs, processes, and outputs.

Facilitate requirements gathering sessions between business and IT.

Negotiates plans and timeframes, ensuring that the business understands the anticipated result.

Develops and communicates detailed specifications for implementation.

Produces reports, timelines, and graphics to communicate expectations and progress to management, customers, investors, and other relevant parties.

Maintains and ensures proper documentation and coordinates or performs testing of system modifications.

Collaborates with the Project Manager to ensure business partner needs are met.

Researches and analyzes the nature, effect, and results of system difficulties.

Satisfies data sampling, project analysis, testing verification, and other user requests from existing client databases.

Acts as liaison with Information Technology and/or outside vendors to support relevant systems.

Maintains current understanding of industry standards, trends, and best practices through industry and other professional networks.

Provides recommendations on system evolution.

Creates, develops, provides, or coordinates system training, materials, and other educational tools.

Helps develop ad hoc data reports using simple query language.

Other duties as assigned.




Required Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Business, or related field required.

At least five to seven years of related experience.

Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

Experience with Agile Methodology

Analytical Thinker

Extremely organized with great attention to detail.

Excellent management skills with the ability to lead, facilitate, motivate, and organize.

Ability to make decisions quickly and with little guidance.

Ability to adapt to change.

Excellent customer service skills.

Ability to learn quickly and to creatively solve new problems.

Ability to negotiate and settle differences quickly and peacefully.

Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite or related software program.

Ability to act as a team player.

Must have experience utilizing Rally or other agile Project Management tools

Preferred Qualifications:

Management Liability and/or P&C Insurance knowledge a preferred.

The Business Analyst role will function as a key contributor in our organization and will be responsible for supporting multiple cross functional Agile teams. We envision this role to be working closely with one or more of our Product Managers, and assist them with numerous aspects of Agile product strategy and execution activities.

Roles and Responsibilities:

SDLC requirements 360 – gathering, definition, clarifications. Documenting epics and user stories for features and enhancements, ensure tasks and subtasks are created by respective technology team members and tracked regularly.
Carry out market and feature research, to help with product roadmaps and priorities.
Vet scope, requirements, use case/user scenario, test case documents and design specifications, in partnership with Product managers, UX, Architecture, Development and QA.
Track epics and stories completion to project timelines, help identify risks and dependencies, escalate to Product manager for timely resolution
Conduct feature testing before release, review results with Product manager and Scrum team and drive next steps
Help with release management coordination across teams including approvals, release notes, internal communication etc.
Tracking feature related metrics and provide regular reporting on crucial features
Help with portfolio budget tracking and reporting
Effectively work with cross-functional teams comprised of both business roles and technical development during the life cycle of product development
Blend strong business acumen, with technical problem solving and agile execution
Partner with IT on development, testing & implementation plans, as well as internal communications & deployment plans
Proactively identify issues and work with internal partners to understand options and execute solve
Follow internal Agile guidelines and bring any additional best practices
Additional projects and responsibilities as assigned

Bachelor's Degree
5+ years working in an Agile development environment in a business or techno-functional role. Including using agile tools such as JIRA, Confluence, analytical tools, AB testing tools etc.
3+ years Digital experience (Especially in Mobile)
Exposure in Product management, including ideation to execution, and launch to maintain.
Strong business and analytical mindset
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Demonstrated collaborative skills and ability to work well within a team

A Behavior Analyst is responsible for the development, training, and proper implementation of Behavior Support Plans (BSPs) and strategies. Services will be conducted 1:1, and can be provided in-home or in community settings. The following job description outlines essential job functions, but may not provide a comprehensive list of duties that may be assigned:

Work collaboratively with assigned BCBA in order to implement basic principles of ABA (Applied Behavior Analysis).
Conduct initial assessments (direct and indirect observations), develop BSPs and/or strategies, train the appropriate team members on how to implement the BSP and/or strategies, and monitor the implementation of Behavior Support Plans (BSPs) and strategies as carried out by families, staff and Behavior Technician.
Review and analyze data provided by families, staff, and or Behavior Technician.
Plan/develop/modify appropriate behavior programs, tracking forms, and other materials.
Review skill and behavior data on an agreed-upon schedule (minimally monthly).
Collaborate with families in the development of behavior support strategies.
Complete quarterly reports.
Attend quarterly Treatment Team Meetings, and present information from quarterly report to the client’s team.
Demonstrate an understanding of behavior analysis strategies in all interactions with clients/families.
Demonstrate empathy and compassion in conduct towards clients.
Demonstrate respect, cooperation, consideration, and tact in dealing with subordinates, peers, supervisors, families and others.
Cooperate with the applicable State Department or Division licensing unit with all reasonable and legally mandated inspections or investigations.
Ideal candidates have at least 1 to 3 years of experience working with individuals with developmental disabilities in an applicable, educational group setting, based on DDD and DOE programs
Bachelor’s degree in Psychology, Education, Applied Behavior Analysis, Social Work, Public Health or related field required.
Registered Behavioral Technician preferred
Experience with physically aggressive and/or self-injurious clients preferred
Ability to lift a minimum of 25 lbs.
Must be 21 years of age or older
Must be legally permitted to work in the United States
Complete State/Federal Criminal Background checks and Central Registry checks
Possess and maintain a valid New Jersey driver’s license (or Resident State)

Job Title: 2024 University Recruiting - Global Workplace & Enterprise Services Environmental, Health & Safety Data Analyst Co-op
Job Description:
Job Description

Join our dynamic team as a Co-op Data Analyst to support our organization's data analytics efforts and Environmental, Health, and Safety (EHS) initiatives. In this role, you will utilize your skills in data analytics, Power BI, and EHS to gather, analyze, and visualize data, enabling evidence-based decision-making and ensuring compliance with EHS regulations. You will work closely with various stakeholders to identify data needs, develop analytics solutions, and provide actionable insights to drive operational excellence.

Responsibilities

Data Analytics:

Collect and organize data from various sources, ensuring accuracy and integrity.

Perform advanced analytics and statistical analysis to identify trends, patterns, and insights.

Develop data models and conduct data mining to discover opportunities or areas of improvement.

Apply data validation techniques to identify data quality issues and recommend solutions.

Transform complex data into easily understandable reports, dashboards, and visualizations.

Power BI:

Utilize Power BI toolset to create interactive visualizations and reports for data-driven decisions.

Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements and create visually compelling dashboards.

Develop custom Power BI components, such as DAX queries, calculated tables, and measures.

Optimize performance and maintain data models within the Power BI platform.

Provide training and support to end-users to maximize their understanding and use of Power BI.

Environmental, Health, and Safety (EHS):

Support EHS initiatives by collecting, analyzing, and reporting relevant data.

Assist in the development and implementation of EHS programs and policies.

Conduct risk assessments, incident investigations, and audits as needed.

Ensure compliance with EHS regulations and internal standards.

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and mitigate EHS risks.

Educational Requirements:

Currently pursuing a degree in Data Analytics, Business Analytics, Environmental Science, Industrial Engineering, or a related field.

Skills and Qualifications:

Strong knowledge and experience in data analytics, statistical analysis, and data visualization.

Proficient in using tools such as Microsoft Power BI, Excel, SQL, or other database management systems.

Familiarity with EHS regulations, guidelines, and best practices.

Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to analyze complex data sets.

Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

Ability to work independently and collaboratively within a team.

Attention to detail and a focus on delivering high-quality work.

Job Description

IT powers our company to save and improve lives. Within our Company IT, the IT Strategy Realization team’s purpose is to lead value-driven outcomes and accelerate how we transform IT. ITSR does this by delivering on six core capabilities: IT Strategy, IT Value Management, IT Product Management, Talent Enablement, IT Communications & Change Management, and IT Continuous Improvement.

The Senior Specialist of Product/Business Analyst is a key role within the IT Strategy Realization department. This individual will be responsible for analyzing business needs and working closely with stakeholders to develop digital and technology solutions that drive business outcomes. The Senior Specialist will report to the Associate Director of Product/Business Analyst and will contribute to the advancement of our Company's IT Strategy.

A partial list of responsibilities includes the following:

Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and analyze business requirements and translate them into user stories.

Perform detailed analysis of existing business processes to identify areas for improvement and optimization.

Assist in the design and development of digital and technology solutions that align with business objectives.

Conduct market research and analysis to identify industry trends and best practices.

Support project execution by managing timelines, resources, and deliverables.

Work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure successful project delivery.

Stay informed about emerging technologies and industry trends.

Participate in the development and execution of training programs for stakeholders.

Limited travel may be required.

Education Minimum Requirement:

Bachelor's Degree required.

Required Experience and Skills:

Minimum of 5 years of experience in business analysis, product management, or a related field.

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

Experience with developing various types of requirements and user stories.

Strong communication and stakeholder management skills.

Good understanding of business processes and the ability to translate business needs into technical requirements.

Preferred Experience and Skills:

Experience working in the pharmaceutical or healthcare industry is a plus.

Understanding of business process modeling notation.

Experience with basic user-focused design techniques (e.g., wireframing, page flow diagramming, data flow diagramming)

Understanding of how to apply organizational change management principles.

Application development experience – especially front-end development.

Familiarity with agile methodologies and tools such as JIRA is preferred.

Experience working within a product organization.

Key Responsibilities:

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to assess their data governance needs.
Develop and implement a federated data governance framework that aligns with organizational objectives.
Establish and enforce data governance policies and standards across different business units.
Organizes, coordinates and assists cross-functional teams in planning, development, and execution of Data Governance oriented business processes at the operational level.
Provide guidance and support to teams in implementing data governance best practices.
Monitor data quality, privacy, and security compliance across the organization.
Conduct regular audits and assessments to identify data governance issues and opportunities for improvement.
Develop and deliver training programs on data governance principles and procedures.
Serve as a subject matter expert on data governance matters, providing guidance to teams as needed.
Builds enterprise dashboards and reporting to ensure proper communicate of the Data Governance program performance.
Act as a liaison between teams to ensure consistent data governance practices.
Stay informed about industry trends and regulations related to data governance.

Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in a related field (e.g., Data Management, Information Technology, Business, or a related discipline).
3-5 years of experience in a Data Governance, Data Management or data centric role.
Strong understanding of data governance principles, standards, and best practices.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to work effectively with various teams.
Strong problem-solving and analytical abilities.
Ability to perform root cause analysis and make recommendations for the remediation of data governance and quality issues.
Ability to adapt to changing environments and priorities.
Ability to extract and analyze data via SQL.
Self-motivated and able to work both independently and as part of a team.
Highly proficient in data profiling techniques and tools.
Experience in working with cross-functional teams in a large organization.
Certification in data management or data governance (e.g., CDMP, DGSP, CISM) is a plus.
Familiarity with data governance tools and software.
Project management skills.

Job Description
The Division of Information Technology at Stevens invites applications for the position of Business Intelligence Analyst to join a team of talented colleagues to shape the data, analytics, and business intelligence landscape at Stevens. This position has responsibility for the analysis of university data and development of business intelligence and analytics solutions and will aid in data governance and data management efforts in tandem with other IT colleagues and campus partners in support of the data service program.
The successful candidate will use knowledge of the overall enterprise data landscape to work collaboratively both with IT team members as well as representatives from academic and administrative units to determine needs for datasets, reports, dashboards, and analytics, and provide solutions to meet those needs. You will work with a team of data professionals as well as data stewards, data analysts, and data consumers across Stevens toward the common goal of using data sharing to enable business objectives and produce insights to support decision-making, performance measurements, and student success. A combination of strong analytical, problem-solving, and interpersonal skills, creativity, project management, and customer-centricity are key characteristics of a successful candidate for this position.
Responsibilities
Identifying all institutional data sources and information assets and developing solutions to utilize those assets, to support enterprise data warehouse and business intelligence projects
Contributing to the implementation and expansion of Stevens’ next generation cloud data warehouse, predictive analytics, and business intelligence platform through the analysis of business requirements and knowledge of data
Designing and developing data models for the enterprise data warehouse to meet both present and future business needs by integrating a variety of data from disparate source systems
Writing queries and building reports, dashboards, and other data visualizations
Creating and maintaining documentation and diagrams of data architecture, data modeling, and data mappings
Evaluating business needs and goals in order to formulate information availability and data analytics solutions, and supporting continuous improvement for the entire data and analytics space
Collaborating with campus constituents to promote awareness of data governance and aiding with the creation and maintenance of data definitions and metadata, as well as processes for data management and sharing, to maintain data consistency and data quality
Working closely with other Information Technology staff across the organization to recommend, plan, implement, and support innovative technology solutions by providing subject matter expertise in the areas of data analysis and other related activities
Proactively and continuously pursuing professional development and training to acquire new knowledge and skills
Performing other duties as assigned.
Breakdown of Essential Duties and Responsibilities
35%: Data analysis
35%: Data/BI/analytics development
20%: Data governance
10%: Other duties as assigned in support of overall IT strategic goals and synergy within IT
Requirements
Bachelor’s degree, preferably in the field of information management, information science, or another data-related field; equivalent training and experience considered
Minimum of three years of relevant experience in an enterprise environment; professional experience in higher education preferred
Experience with business analysis of data assets at all levels of an organization
Solid command of relational and dimensional database concepts/principles, data modeling, query and report development, business intelligence methods, and data visualization
Experience with modern cloud data warehouse platforms and business intelligence products; Snowflake and Power BI preferred
Proficiency with SQL and data querying and modeling tools
Knowledge of data cataloging and data quality analysis
Energetic, passionate, and self-motivated mindset with a strong desire to excel and flourish in a fast-paced and dynamic environment and a commitment to continued self-improvement
Strong interpersonal, written, and oral communication skills, and the ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical audiences
Strong organizational, prioritization, and planning skills with an ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously and collaboratively with cross-functional units
Sound independent judgment and decision-making
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with high attention to detail.
About Information Technology:
The integration of advanced technology throughout all levels of study is ubiquitous across universities – it facilitates digital transformations and ultimately shapes the future of higher education.
At Stevens, our legacy is built on technology. The Division of Information Technology not only acknowledges but wholeheartedly supports this opportunity to drive our community's advancement in technology and innovation. In order to foster collaboration in the areas of teaching and learning, student success, research and scholarship, service and outreach, and administrative operations – we implement value-driven strategic solutions and support new technologies with enhanced security in an increasingly remote space. Along the way, the Division of Information Technology strives to meet global challenges that require us to turn inward, unveiling a shared vision of empathetic leadership, accountability, and exceptional customer-centric services that fully support and empower our students, faculty, staff, alumni, and the vision and mission of Stevens.
Department
Office of Enterprise Platform and Data Services

JLL supports the Whole You, personally and professionally.

Our people at JLL are shaping the future of real estate for a better world by combining world class services, advisory and technology to our clients. We are committed to hiring the best, most talented people in our industry; and we support them through professional growth, flexibility, and personalized benefits to manage life in and outside of work. Whether you’ve got deep experience in commercial real estate, skilled trades, and technology, or you’re looking to apply your relevant experience to a new industry, we empower you to shape a brighter way forward so you can thrive professionally and personally.

The Energy & Sustainability Analyst will join JLL’s Energy & Sustainability Center of Excellence, to support the delivery of energy and sustainability products and services to a large financial client.

These include:
Managing utility supplies and data gathering from a wide range of sources

Maintain completeness and accuracy of utility data, property data, etc. in databases to ensure consistency and accuracy of reporting

Providing insights from utility data

Resolve utility account issues by working with utility companies and bill processing firm.

Reporting – generate site and portfolio reports from data management systems regarding energy consumption and projected consumption based on conservation opportunities

Energy Analysis –analyze properties within the portfolio for trends and anomalies in energy consumption.

Sustainability Analysis – analyze waste, recycling and water trends.

Supporting energy managers with energy calculations

Participate in Energy Team process improvement projects

Assist with the generation of utility budgets

What this job involves

Key responsibilities include:
Performing data analysis and calculations to produce monthly, quarterly and annual energy, environmental and sustainability reports for both internal and external stakeholders.

Maintaining completeness and accuracy of utility data, property data, etc. in databases to ensure consistency and accuracy of reporting.

Identifying anomalies and perform gap analysis of the energy & sustainability data and work with client to include corrective actions, including measures which improve the efficiency of data capture.

Performing utility review and resolving utility account issues by working with utility companies and bill processing firms.

Undertaking data analysis to identify trends and opportunities for operational improvement, energy conservation opportunities, and potential cost reduction.

Providing support to the Energy & Sustainability Manager on each account to provide the necessary energy and sustainability metrics that are being tracked.

Preparing environmental reporting in accordance with globally recognized protocols, such as CDP and DJSI.

Provide support in creating and implementation of energy & sustainability management strategy

Every day is different, and in all these activities, we’d encourage you to show your ingenuity.

Sound like you? To apply you need to be / have:
Requirements -Essential
University Degree (Science, engineering, math or related fields)

Proficient in using MS Excel, Access and SQL to combine and analyze data from various sources, and generate reports and graphics. Must be able to combine large volumes of data for consolidated reporting.

Experienced performing data analysis and identify the gaps and trends in data

Detail-oriented with excellent time management and follow-through.

Basic understanding of HVAC and building energy systems

Has experience running Green House Gas Emission calculations

Familiarity with sustainability related certification and benchmarking tools

Ability to communicate effectively and provide detailed or brief explanation of the data analysis results

Understand the client’s energy & sustainability goals and provide support in implementation of the program to reach those goals

Requirements – Desirable

Technical understanding of the most common HVAC, electrical, mechanical, and building automation systems

In-depth understanding of energy and water conservation measures

Experienced with benchmarking and analyzing utility data to drive sustainability measures

In-depth understanding of Greenhouse Gas Emission scopes and reporting

Ability to explain difficult or sensitive information and work to build consensus

Ability to communicate directly with the client and manage expectations

Ability to develop an energy & sustainability program

Behavioral Competencies
Think Big - Thinks strategically, simplifies the complex, solves complex problems, sees the big picture

Drive Change - Thrives on change, learning agility, intellectually curious, appetite for risks, digital drive

Helps others - Builds relationships, actively collaborates, helps others succeed.

Get it done - Acts decisively, drives results, passion to win, takes ownership, accountable, resilient

Business first - Focuses on customers and clients, business/financial acumen, JLL first

Inspire - Inspire others, creates vision and strategy, energizes others

We’re JLL—a leading professional services and investment management firm specializing in real estate. Overview:
Job Summary

NJEDA’s Venture Programs Department seeks an outstanding Investment Analyst candidate to collaborate with a team of highly motivated financial professionals, who are passionate about advancing New Jersey’s innovation economy. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to support the team’s product portfolio including, but not limited to, the New Jersey Innovation Evergreen Fund (NJIEF), New Jersey Innovation Fellows (NJIF), NJ Founders & Funders, Venture Fund Investment, SSBCI Life Sciences Fund, SSBCI SEDI Seed Fund, and the Black and Latino Seed Fund programs.

Innovation can occur anywhere, but it may have the greatest chance of success when born and fostered with the collaboration of interested partners. The NJEDA’s Venture Programs Department manages a suite of programs designed to support a virtuous cycle of innovation in the State by engaging with New Jersey’s large corporate citizens, early-stage businesses, and venture capital and angel investors. The successful candidate will assist in the execution and management of these programs by identifying and evaluating key stakeholders, providing research support, and supporting program processes.

The successful candidate will participate in the design, development, implementation, and administration of Venture Programs. Additionally, the Investment Analyst will interact directly with stakeholders to gather intelligence and build relationships in support of sustainable economic development policy. The applicant should have a first-hand insight of program management, business development, relationship management, government operations, and venture capital fund investment analysis. This person also maintains a general working knowledge of other NJEDA Programs and Departments in order to support, promote, and manage NJEDA’s offerings effectively to manage external and internal relationships.

$65,484 - $81,855

Note: The NJEDA currently offers a hybrid work schedule for up to 2 days of telecommute work from home. To participate, you will be required to have high speed home internet access and a managers approval. This program does not supersede the "New Jersey First Act", which requires newly hired NJEDA employees to establish and then maintain, principal residence in the State of New Jersey.
Responsibilities:
Essential Duties and Responsibilities

Support the Venture Programs Director and Staff with their efforts to launch and administer the department’s suite of Venture Programs.
Reviews program applications for program adherence and advances various applications through the approval queue, with acute attention to detail.
Performs periodical statistical analysis and activity memorandums regarding the status of Venture Programs and of program applicants. This would include work within various computer systems to perform functions like report generation and data accuracy and updating and maintaining these systems and/or interacting with relevant team members with this access and ability.
Works with internal and external stakeholders to effectively communicate the requirements and opportunities associated with the NJIEF, NJIF, Venture Fund Investment, SSBCI Life Sciences Fund, SSBCI SEDI Seed Fund, and the Black and Latino Seed Fund programs, among others.
Develops methods and tools to evaluate Venture Programs Department product processes, key performance indicators, eligibility, execution, and compliance monitoring.
Works with NJEDA colleagues to manage relationships with key industry stakeholders, including venture capital firms, startups, angel investors, and corporate investor funds, and acts as an industry-development advocate; these efforts may include representing the Authority at industry events and participating in business development calls and meetings, and acting as a company liaison within the NJEDA.
Research and develop a business development pipeline of potential investor, entrepreneurs, corporate tax credit purchasers, and other innovation ecosystem stakeholders to partner with the NJEDA’s suite of Venture Programs Department products.
Promotes teamwork and communication to encourage an interactive, cooperative, collaborative, and customer focused work environment among division, NJEDA staff, and external customers.
Learns and utilizes the NJEDA’s Customer Relationship Management (CRM) database per departmental standards including populating key application data in various CRM records.
Maintains deep innovation economy industry expertise through project-based research and analysis; these efforts may include tracking industry trends at the state, regional, and national level, identifying which key industry issues state government could help to resolve, providing industry and policy updates to internal government stakeholders.
Collaborates with NJEDA’s marketing and communications teams to assure program web pages are accurate, programs are accurately marketed, success stories are shared, and program outcomes are reported to Executive Committee, board and program enhancements/efficiencies and improvements are recommended.
Demonstrates a leadership and ownership mindset within the Venture Programs Department and Economic Transformation Division including suggesting new ideas for how to improve the Division.
Develops best practices which can be institutionalize across multiple programs; defines and implements needed systems and policies.
Attends team meetings. Provides relevant updates to report progress and achievements.
Performs other duties and special projects, as may be assigned.
Promotes teamwork and communication to encourage an interactive, cooperative, collaborative, and customer- focused work environment among division, NJEDA staff, and external customers.
Liaises across departments within NJEDA and external government stakeholders to maintain forward progress on mechanics associated with accounting, compliance, information technology, legal, marketing, policy, and tax.
Collaborates in the development and achievement of the Venture Programs Department and Economic Transformation division goals; reviews and evaluates own performance against key metrics.
Participates in setting goals and objectives and assesses progress against individual plans to provide input on semiannual and annual reviews.
Must complete annual and semi-annual self-assessment as required.
Performs duties to the highest standards of ethics and professionalism.
Qualifications:
Required Skills and Abilities

Strong creative and advanced analytical and research skills, including the ability to analyze data, prepare data visualization materials and other relevant documentation for the sector leaders with limited errors and oversight.
Interest in policy, legal framework development, investment analysis, venture-manager evaluations, and execution.
Ability to synthesize findings and propose actionable solutions.
Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing; proficient in grammar, spelling and editing; and foster communications with business professionals and NJEDA staff.
Ability to prioritize workload, be highly organized, detail-oriented, handle various tasks simultaneously, and work independently within limited time constraints with little or no supervision.
Best-in-Authority ability to engage in the technical details of the various products within the Venture Programs Department.
Ability to identify programs and initiatives via conversations with key stakeholders and monitor successful programs from other states and countries.
Ability to engage credibly and thoughtfully in broader economic development conversations with industry and government leaders.
Deep knowledge and understanding of economic development, sector development approaches, community development, and public policy and governance related to the Analyst’s specific program responsibility.
Deep understanding of NJEDA’s existing programs and services.
Demonstrated ability to self-motivate and self-lead own work planning and execution with a strong results orientation.
Ability to adapt to changes in work environment and manage competing demands.
Must be able to maintain confidentiality and deal effectively and diplomatically with business professionals and NJEDA staff.
Demonstrate respectful behavior and promote teamwork and communication to encourage an interactive, cooperative, collaborative and customer focused work environment among division, NJEDA staff and external customers.
Ability to build strong relationships and contacts within the industry.
NJEDA utilizes Microsoft as the core application platform and proficiency in the Microsoft Office Suite is preferred.

Required Qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree, preferably in a relevant field such as business, finance, or policy.
Industry-facing experience in finance, consulting, startups, a government agency or related field is required.
Experience in a fast-paced, project-based professional services environment that emphasizes teamwork, problem solving, and communication (e.g., management consulting, banking, legal field, large-scale project management, etc.).
Experience in program development, public policy development, corporate finance, and financial analysis.
Advanced degree or industry specific certification may be substituted for 1 year of experience.

Physical Demands
Minimal
Ability to work outside normal business hours, as needed

Travel
As necessary to events, meetings, businesses, etc.

Certificates and Licenses Required
License: Staff are required to possess a driver's license valid in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle, rather than employee mobility, is necessary to perform the essentials duties of the position.

By joining Chubb as a Senior Data Analyst, you will analyze and certify data, troubleshoot data issues, promote data quality, work directly with the business and developers to document requirements and technical specifications and lead the delivery of key projects in support of North America Statutory Reporting from the enterprise data warehouse. Our data warehouse platform is a strategic application within the business, feeding into multiple systems and applications both up and downstream with data that directly supports business decisions being made each and every day. With us, you’ll leverage your knowledge of SQL and database tables to analyze data, identify gaps or discrepancies, and partner with applications teams, IT teams across the business, our stakeholders, and our Data Architect to drive solutions that directly impacts how data is used throughout the business. You will lead reporting initiatives, delivering solutions from inception to reporting submission while working within budget and timelines. Through it all, we’ll also look to you to share your ideas and manage data related projects end to end that influence how we incorporate, validate, and distribute data enterprise-wide.

In this role, you will:

Lead all phases of the development, testing, and implementation life cycle, defining, documenting, and reviewing all requirements, creating test scenarios, developing test plans, analyzing results and testing/validating data
Work with business partners, project management, architecture, development, and leadership to deliver reporting solutions on-time, within budget and with data accuracy.
Document requirements, technical specifications, and implementation documentation on all reporting solutions.
Reconcile multiple data sources and identify the root cause of discrepancies in expected output; distinguish between multiple root causes and/or multiple trends in a given data set and articulate results to various stakeholders, management, and technical resources
Analyze and test relational databases and investigate any data load failures or data retrieval issues
Monitor data warehousing systems based on assigned tasks to ensure reliability and accuracy of information loaded into the databases
Generate reports, dashboards, and ad hoc extracts for business and/or leadership
Ensure data integrity by implementing quality assurance practices, gathering, and entering missing data, and resolving any anomalies


7+ years of experience in a Data Analysis, Business Analysis, Data Quality Assurance (or similar) role as part of a data warehouse team and supporting data-driven projects
Experience working with DBMS platforms, including a demonstrated understanding of table structures, hierarchies, joins, etc.
Advanced knowledge of SQL, with the ability to write and troubleshoot medium to advanced SQL queries
Knowledge of data warehousing methodologies and tools including their connection to systems both up and down stream
Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science, or a related discipline preferred
Prior experience within the insurance industry or related to regulatory reporting is preferred
Previous experience with Azure Synapse, Informatica Intelligent Cloud Services (IICS), and/or reporting tools, such as Qlik, Spotfire is a plus

Job Title: Specialist, Business of IT Product / Business Analyst (Hybrid)
Job Description:
Job Description

IT powers our company to save and improve lives. Within our Company IT, the IT Strategy Realization team’s purpose is to lead value-driven outcomes and accelerate how we transform IT. ITSR does this by delivering on six core capabilities: IT Strategy, IT Value Management, IT Product Management, Talent Enablement, IT Communications & Change Management, and IT Continuous Improvement.

The Specialist, Product/Business Analyst is an entry-level role within IT Strategy Realization. This individual will support the analysis of business needs and assist in the development of digital and technology solutions. The Specialist will report to the Associate Director of Product/Business Analyst and will contribute to the achievement of our Company's IT Strategy goals.

A partial list of responsibilities includes the following:

Assist in gathering and documenting business requirements.

Perform basic analysis of existing business processes.

Support the design and development of digital and technology solutions.

Conduct research to gather information on industry trends and best practices.

Assist in project management tasks such as timeline tracking and resource coordination.

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver project milestones.

Stay updated on emerging technologies and industry developments.

Support the execution of training programs for stakeholders.

Limited travel may be required.

High School Diploma required.

1+ years of experience in business analysis, product management, or a related field (internships and entry-level positions can be counted).

Basic understanding of business processes.

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

Good communication and teamwork skills.

Preferred Experience and Skills:

Interest in the pharmaceutical or healthcare industry.

Experience with business process modeling.

Experience with developing user stories.

Experience with user-centric design.

Understanding of organizational change management principles.

Familiarity with agile methodologies and tools is a plus.

Experience working within a product organization.

The Role

Our Healthcare consulting practice is looking for a Technical Product Owner to join our journey.

We’re looking for Senior Consultants who can deliver within Cognizant’s Five Pillars of Consulting Excellence: 1) Project Execution, 2) Expertise, 3) Business Development, 4) Practice Development, & 5) People Development. As a Senior Consultant, this means partnering with clients and project stakeholders, colleagues to clarify requirements and support delivery of effective solutions; applying technical and domain expertise to solve core client business challenges or inefficiencies; developing and strengthening domain knowledge and maintaining an accurate understanding of Cognizant’s industry propositions and consulting capabilities; supporting business development activities of senior leaders; contributing to the development of practice initiatives or new service offerings (e.g., Strategic Control Points, development of consulting assets); and being an inspiring colleague, promoting team motivation, partnership, and ownership for projects. In addition to enabling consulting excellence through the Five Pillars of Consulting, the specific requirements for this position are below.

Our solutions are in demand and we’re passionate about making a difference. If you have experience with the above, are a selfless leader, and are committed to client-facing environment; if you want to grow your career with a team that wants to build something great together, we want to hear from you! Apply now!




Essential Job Functions:

Work as a member of a large scrum team and have the technical credibility to drive constructive discussions and decisions on priority, interdependencies, and related processes Translate high level requirements into products and product features. Create work items in stories in backlog. Work closely with engineering and QA to validate that the work item meets acceptance criteria.
Develop user stories from solution architect’s design and customer requirements including details of the data interfaces within the different layers of the data platform.
Provide vision and direction to the Agile development team and stakeholders and create requirements that meet the product and business needs/vision.
Prioritize stories, epics and themes to ensure work focuses on those with maximum value that are aligned with product strategy.
Bring technical expertise to key initiatives such as 3rd party application integrations, user administration & management, user authentication, platform security initiatives, etc. Collaborate with Engineering & Product Managers on resources, scope, prioritization, processes, and deliverables.



Responsibilities

Based on experience, support or own and manage one or more project workstream(s), including deliverables, while adhering to budget, timelines, and client engagement guidelines.
Partner with clients and project stakeholders and apply technical and domain expertise to solve core client business challenges or inefficiencies; this may include leading and managing small solutioning teams to accomplish the above
Elevate the Cognizant brand from mere solution vendor to business-focused transformation partner, based on earning the trust and confidence of clients.
Ensure accurate understanding of a client’s business challenges and their optimum alignment to engagements delivering Cognizant solutions.
Capitalize on successful project outcomes in pursuit of further client business partnering and involvement with the client’s development of strategic digital transformation roadmaps.
Collaborate with and influence Cognizant project resources (e.g., service lines, SBUs, on/offshore delivery teams) and Partners on behalf of project goals, often-changing client needs, and ultimately client delight.
Leverage specific engagement solutions as marketable Cognizant solution offerings.
Develop practice capabilities and brand recognition by exercising thought leadership, establishing a consultative presence within Cognizant and the wider consulting community, and participating in professional organizations.
Participate in PeopleCare activities, Mentor and support less experienced Consultants for the benefit of the practice.



Qualifications

Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and experience with a preferred area of study in technology, business, project management
8+ years’ experience as a product owner or technical product owner
5+ years’ experience with software delivery
3+ years of hands-on experience with Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) or Scrum Agile development
Prior experience working with healthcare data on analytical platforms
Familiarity with big data distributed systems, container orchestration (Docker, K8), and cloud technologies (AWS/ Azure/ GCP)
Ability to juggle multiple projects and scrum teams with demonstrated knowledge of Agile/SCRUM

Looking for IT/Business Systesms Analysts. The ideal candidate(s) should have the following qualifiactions:

Education: Minimum of Bachelor’s or Higher degree in computer science, information systems,or related specific field.
Understanding of SDLC Methodologies & processes – Waterfall and Agile/Scrum.
Ability to integrate with teams, demonstrating strong verbal and written communication skills
Problem-solving skills and critical thinking are essential to effectively conduct the required tasks.

Analyzes the client environment and new business requirements to define solutions that meet client needs and have the flexibility to accommodate future changes. Develop and evaluate alternative system solutions to meet client requirements.
Work with technical teams and business partners to define/refine business rules and processes
Maintain the group focus, lead meetings toward stated goals and manage the group dynamics in facilitating requirements gathering and review sessions including writing Agile epics and user stories.
Proactively seek to understand current technology of engineering teams as well as needs and gaps
Understand how technology needs of engineering teams align with the environments, processes and tools developed and maintained by the foundations teams.
Facilitate technology discussions between engineering teams and foundations teams regarding schedule and priority
Partner with the engineering teams to develop, quantify, and track technical KPIs to measure improvement
Facilitate the collection of operational requirements, communicate how they fit into milestones and minimum viable products for releases and track completion
Collaborate with Product owner and scrum master to define, through written and verbal documentation, features and EPICs (higher level user stories) and decompose into user stories that developers can follow with clear acceptance criteria.
Review external requirements and ask the appropriate questions to clarify these requirements and route them to the appropriate technology domain
Coordinate and manage vendors (when applicable) responsible for various components of the platform.
Effectively communicate expectations to team members and stakeholders in a timely and clear fashion
Review project deliverables to ensure completeness & adherence to standards; Manage risks and issues
Monitor post-production processes to ensure accurate completion of all details
Clearly communicate stories and acceptance criteria to dev and QA to shape test scripts
Participate in user stories creation, story slicing, backlog grooming, release planning, sprint planning, sprint review and sprint retrospective.
Produce technical documentation including environment diagrams and process flows.
Use Advanced REST Client and POSTMAN to validate reading and writing functionality of API/Services.
Draw UML (Use Case, Flowcharts, Sequence, State machine, Component, Activity) diagrams in Business Documents (BRD, FRS, UI Specs) using Rational Rose/Visio and provide walkthrough to the development team.
Participate/Conduct design meetings to outline the structure of components like Database design (DB Table Schema), application design, using flowcharts, ER-diagrams etc., with fellow developers in the team.
Map business entities to Database tables columns, data types and provide required business and custom validations to the team.
Define messaging standards and format using XSD for external/internal interfaces for application components.
Use Automation Tools to test & confirm the application release is matching requirements.
Define NFR (Non-Functional Requirements) like Security, throughput/SLA requirements and work with developers to validate in SIT, UAT environments.
Review TER (Test Exit Report) with Test team and validate the application release to production.
Active role in programming methodology, computer software, report generation methods, data communication and transaction-based processing.
Analyze data using Tableau and Google Fusion tables.
Design prototypes (Lucid Charts), defect tracking in JIRA and conduct review meetings with the team, to clearly define requirements and Plan Sprints.
Review user stories and daily plan/task list with team. Participate in Daily Stand-up, product grooming and sprint retrospectives.
Create Documentation/Data Visualization reports as the application progresses to provide knowledge and to collaborate effectively with the team.

Job Title: Senior Data and Insights Business Unit Analyst
Job Description:
Johnson & Johnson MedTech (JJMT) is recruiting for a Senior Analyst, Sales Compensation Design, ETHICON. The position is located in Cincinnati, OH, or Raritan, NJ, supporting the Ethicon businesses.

Johnson & Johnson MedTech Companies produce a broad range of innovative products and solutions used primarily by healthcare professionals. JJMT contains key surgical platforms in Open and Minimally Invasive devices and surgical products. As the most comprehensive devices business in the world, JJMT is best suited to serve evolving customer needs, train more surgeons to improve standards of care, and treat more patients globally as access expands. JJMT has over $20 billion in Worldwide sales. The business is expected to experience solid growth over the next 5 to 7 years.

Reporting directly to the Director of Compensation, the Senior Analyst, Sales Compensation Design, ETHICON, is responsible for implementing sales compensation plan design consistent with Enterprise business strategy, supporting the allocation of sales quota tied to Enterprise financial business plan, and completing sales and data analyses in support of business decisions.

Responsibilities:

Sales Compensation Design/Quota Allocation

Build and validate forecast modeling and sophisticated statistical analyses across complex data sets to craft compensation design and quota allocation decisions by executive leaders
Leverage AI, automated learning, and machine learning technologies to illustrate trends in performance and compensation forecasting
Develop quota-setting methods to enhance sales force engagement using predictive analytics, forecast modeling, and advanced statistical analysis
Build and validate strategies designed to drive sales behavior key to achieving strategic business objectives and financial commitments
Collaborate with other Compensation and Execution partners on results.
Partner closely with Director Compensation – Ethicon, Compensation Analysts, and Data Integrity Analysts at all levels across multiple internal teams on compensation plan design, quota and quota adjustments, predictive analytics, comp and product plan parameters, systems programming and performance metrics
Align compensation plans and payout mechanisms with J&J compensation philosophy
Monitor and measure compensation plan effectiveness through statistical analysis using data sources and systems
Apply advanced systems knowledge to plan, design, and configure data systems integral in the build and successful delivery of Sales Compensation Plans and Quota.
Partner with IT and Systems Teams to measure impact and develop resolution roadmaps for systems configuration and/or issues
Deliver payout and performance metrics across the Enterprise
Partner closely with J&J systems teams, IT, and external business partners to drive efficiencies across multiple computing and data systems
Maintain policies and procedures in partnership with Commercial team members.
Support cross-functional and cross-sector projects beyond Ethicon as needed.
Additional Potential Role Responsibilities will be assigned as determined by leadership and driven by plan evolution/tied to business strategy.
QUALIFICATIONS
A minimum of a bachelor’s degree is required.
Finance, analytics, or commercial operations experience is strongly preferred if not already included in academic focus.
Medical Device or Pharmaceutical experience is preferred.
Statistical analysis, data analytics, and systems programming/coding skills preferred.
AI (artificial intelligence), automated learning and machine learning experience preferred.
Experience with sales compensation programs for team-based sales forces is preferred.
Experience interacting with or directly supporting a Field Sales organization is preferred.
Budget management experience is preferred.
Demonstrated leadership, critical thinking, collaboration, strong communication, and influencing skills are required.
Shown ability to work in a matrix organization is preferred.
Proficiency in advanced Excel, Access, and PowerPoint is preferred, along with analytical software such as Tableau, R, Python
This role is based in either Cincinnati, OH or Raritan, NJ, with up to 10% domestic travel required.

Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies are equal opportunity employers, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

JOB DESCRIPTION & TASKS

Digital Associate Consultants at ATCS Inc. require digitally savvy analysts with friendly personalities and a professional presence for this client-facing role. Consultants at ATCS are capable of meeting the demanding needs of our clients in various regions around the world (North America, EMEA, Latin America, and APAC). Project coordination and client-facing skills are required at this level to be successful.

Project coordination responsibilities at ATCS begin with an Associate Consultant. Consultants spend their first few months becoming familiar with their team and learning about the best practices and expectations of the role, our company services and our clients’ business models. In addition, individuals will experience a rapid development of the digital and social media skills required to succeed in the role

and meet our high-quality deliverables. As a new team member, you will begin by shadowing project/engagement managers to observe their daily tasks, learn from their best practices and gain an understanding of what our team and clients expect from individuals in this role.

The desired candidates should be able conduct research for clients to support the identification, implementation and testing of technology and digital solutions. This position entails regular communication with international clients and peers via workshops to gather business requirements,

understand changes in project design and manage day-to-day operational requests. They will work closely with clients to create and present valuable insights and data-driven recommendations to answer key business objectives around social outreach, social engagement, and social media campaigns. They will work with India development and support teams in the implementation, configuration, and management of digital software solutions, including, but not limited to Social Studio, Talkwalker, Brandwatch, Hootsuite, Influencer Management Platforms, Command Centers and custom developed applications.

To maintain efficiency, Consultants must track operational and project tasks daily with our offshore India team, identify risks, and communicate status with all respective parties involved. In an environment that demands fast-paced adaptation, consultants are required to take corrective action to help adjust plans with the client in the case that projects or tasks are lagging. Task management is owned by the Associate Consultant.

Associate Consultant Responsibilities:

Analyze data and turn it into information that can be easily understood.
Collect and analyze customer, marketing, and web behavioral data.
Capture meeting discussions and provide summary of tasks, deliverables, outstanding topics and conclusions
Track and manage operational support tasks.
Understand business needs and help design appropriate solutions
Quickly identify abnormalities or unexpected results in reports, dashboards, and emails while analyzing a variety of data sources.
Develop and present learnings from your analyses, including actionable insights and recommendations.
Track and adhere to timelines and deliverables for long and short-term projects.
Be responsible for staying abreast of best practices in social media campaigns, social native platform capabilities, trends in how companies utilize social for promotion, and identification of new social/digital marketing platforms.
Spot digital trends and telling a story with the data on how they impact cross-channel marketing, including emerging and not yet widely adopted trends/channels.
Deliver insightful, visually interesting reports for clients with implications and next steps.
Present in-person, over the phone, and via webinar to clients.


REQUIREMENTS

Bachelor’s Degree with 0-2 years of experience
High sense of urgency
Proficient with native social media platforms and aggregator tools
Solid understanding of online analytics and social and digital metrics
Ability to thrive in a discipline where tools, technology and skills are constantly evolving
Independent time management and prioritization skills
Excellent writing and verbal communications skills with a proven ability to summarize and present complex findings clearly and concisely – both written and spoken
A team player in a fast-paced, complex, and sometimes ambiguous business environment
Ability to distill analyses into concise recommendations and present to various levels of audiences up to the executive level
Ability to multi-task and actively monitor various projects


PREFERRED EXPERIENCE

Communications, Digital/Social Media Marketing, Market Research/Insights, or Business majors preferred


LANGUAGES

Required: English
Additional languages are a benefit


COMPANY BACKGROUND

ATCS is a digital solutions, product and services company helping organizations with digital transformation through use of visual concepts, innovative technologies, professional IT consultants and a globally diverse workforce with a passion for helping our clients succeed.

With 20 years’ experience, onsite presence in North America, Europe and Asia, ATCS provides seamless offshoring development with local expertise. Supporting industries of Automotive, Aftermarket/Aftersales, Pharmaceutical, Life Sciences and Food & Beverage we bring industry benchmark ideas to life quickly, cost effectively, and collaboratively, while maintaining quality expectation.

Why ATCS?

OUR PEOPLE WORK DIFFERENTLY.

You own it! That's right, from start to finish you will own the project with minimal levels of management. ATCS is a small, but global firm that strives in building capable professionals that can handle the full responsibility of owning it. What you conceptualize and design is what you will ultimately deliver. Get to see your ideas put into production. Do you have an interest in Automotive operations, even better! Be exposed to Fortune 500 clients and work with team members and clients from China, India, Germany and North America. What you learn and are exposed to in one year will take your peers five years to experience! We are a flat, agile and culturally diverse organization looking for professionally driven individuals that want to put their career in high gear!

We help our clients succeed through a diverse, innovative, collaborative, and agile team providing a unique value proposition focused on SPEED, COST, FLEXIBILITY, and INNOVATION.

Benefits:

Significant opportunity for growth
Flat organization
Creative work environments
Global travel opportunities
Diverse organization
Client facing
Development of all skills required to succeed in any business environment
Future business development opportunities


The sponsoring of visas is not available for this role.

Overview
Imperial Dade, a leading North American distributor, has a role available in North Bergen, NJ! The Human Resources Compensation Department is hiring a talented Compensation Analyst! The Compensation Analyst will evaluate and analyze compensation elements of our total rewards package to ensure we provide a competitive and equitable program. Assist in developing and implementing compensation programs that are fair, competitive and align with the company’s business goals.

Imperial Dade is the leading independently owned and operated distributor of foodservice packaging and janitorial supplies in North America. As a provider of customized supply chain solutions, we serve customers in many business-to-business market segments including restaurants, grocery stores, healthcare, sports and entertainment, and cruise lines. Founded in 1935 and headquartered in New Jersey, Imperial Dade serves as a mission-critical partner to more than 90,000 customers through our footprint of 125+ branches.


**All correspondence will come directly from Imperial Dade and not a personal email address.**

Responsibilities

You will:

Evaluate jobs to determine classification and appropriate salary range using relevant market survey data while considering internal equity.
Review and recommends salary placements for new hires, promotions, and market adjustments in partnership with Human Resources Business Partners and Talent Acquisition with guidance and approval from Director, Compensation.
Participate in salary surveys and analyzes data from survey sources to determine competitiveness both internally and externally.
Assist with year-end compensation processes, including merit and incentives, data audits, communications, and processing.
Assist with variable pay design, analysis, payment calculation and budget modeling.
Assist with executive compensation projects such as administering long term incentive plan, and equity management tool.
Qualifications
You have:
Bachelor’s degree in business, Finance/Accounting or Human Resources management or equivalent.
3-5 years of experience supporting compensation efforts with knowledge of compensation principles, programs, and practices.
Extensive knowledge of quantitative qualitative and research methods.
Must be able to work in a fast-paced changing environment and be able to use independent judgment for decisions that may not be straightforward.
Strong technical knowledge of excel is required including development of spreadsheets with formulas, functions pivot tables, and lookups.
Must be detail oriented with strong analytical skills and be able to interpret and present analytics in an easily understandable format.
Ability to prioritize and handle multiple projects at once.
Ability to handle sensitive HR information with a high degree of confidentiality and discretion.
Excellent interpersonal, communication and organizational skills.
Schedule: Monday - Friday
Pay: $75k - $80k/yr.

Description

Are you passionate about creating a bridge between IT, Medical and Commercial organizations?

Do you have experience within defining, designing, and implementing technical solutions in the medical space?

If so, now is your chance to join Ascendis Pharma as our new Technical Business Analyst.

Ascendis Pharma is a fast-growing biopharmaceutical company with locations in Denmark, Germany, and the United States.

We are applying our TransCon technology to build a leading, fully integrated biopharmaceutical company focused on making a meaningful difference in patients’ lives. Guided by our core values of patients, science, and passion, we use our TransCon® drug development platform to fulfill our mission of developing new and potentially best-in-class therapies to address unmet medical needs. Today, we have a growing pipeline of prodrug therapies in development, each designed to be a best-in-class therapy.

We are seeking a passionate Technical Business Analyst to join our growing team. As a key member of the Ascendis Pharma team, you will play a crucial role in enable our global Medical organization with technology. The Medical organization is currently embarking on several digitization initiatives spanning from supporting field-based medical teams to building out internal Real World Evidence capabilities to support the rapid commercial expansion of Ascendis Pharma.

This is an exciting opportunity to work in a fast-paced environment, collaborate with cross-functional, global teams working together to achieve extraordinary results.

You will join the Ascendis Pharma Global IT, Continuous Delivery organization, consisting of product teams delivering to business value streams. You will join the Medical IT product team, where you will work closely together with the Product Owner, Scrum Master and other team members. Our product teams are self-managing and follow an agile delivery model.

You will report directly to Business Partner Ivanna Rosendal who is based in Palo Alto, California. You will be based in Princeton, New Jersey.

Your key responsibilities will be:
Serve as the Technical Business Analyst for new solutions being defined and implemented in the Medical space, such as Medical Information, Publications, RWE environment, Websites, Expanded Access Portal, MedComms, CRM.
For these solutions, map the business process to ensure technology fit, collect user stories, understand the data structure and data flows, ensure configuration of solutions fits with the business needs, document solution design and ensure it is tested.
Work with our business stakeholders in both US and Europe.
Lead data migration efforts when switching vendors.
Lead discovery and decision-making meetings and workshops to arrive at the best possible. technical solution with business stakeholders.
Work effectively with software partners, vendors, and service providers to ensure we deliver value to our business users.
Work with QA, data privacy and compliance teams to ensure systems are compliant and secure, adhering to processes/procedures in place.

Requirements

Qualifications and Skills:
You hold a relevant academic degree – probably a bachelor’s degree in a related discipline – and a minimum of 5 years of experience in related roles within a pharmaceutical, biotechnology or similar environment.

Furthermore, you have:
Minimum 1 year of demonstrated technical business analysis skills.
Understanding of medical IT space in life sciences – ideally both from US and Europe.
Experience with business process mapping, data migration and system configuration.
Great presentation skills and experience with workshop facilitation is an advantage.

Key competencies:
You are a strong team player, analytical, and have a can-do attitude.

You possess an agile and entrepreneurial mindset and can thrive in matrixed team structure, open and informal environment where innovation and change are key.

To succeed in this role, we also expect you to be agile, hungry for new learning opportunities and able to

Travel: 20-30 days per year.

Office: Princeton, New Jersey, US.
